Title: Data Engineer (AWS)
text:
Estamos ampliando nuestros equipos y aunque no nos importan mucho los títulos, llamamos a este rol Data Engineer y la clave es tener experiencia en cloud y un deseo constante de seguir aprendiendo.




Nuestra visión es construir equipos multidisciplinares que gestionen directamente los proyectos de forma AGIL para encontrar e implementar las mejores soluciones 😊.




¿Qué harás?




Participarás en la creación de plataformas de datos, ayudando a definir cómo la inteligencia artificial puede ayudar al negocio
Implementarás buenas prácticas en ingeniería en el área de datos e inteligencia artificial
Desarrollarás proyectos desde cero bajo supervisión mínima y con la colaboración del equipo
Participarás en el diseño de arquitecturas y toma de decisiones en un entorno constructivo y con dinámica de cocreación
Desarrollarás ETLs con Spark (Python)
Desarrollarás proyectos en cloud (Azure, AWS)
Construirás pipelines escalables con diferentes tecnologías: airflow, data factory,..
Participarás en procesos de preventa, desde fases tempranas en relaciones con clientes, siendo capaz de entender las necesidades del negocio, para encontrar la mejor solución técnica




Requirements




¿Qué buscamos?




Sólida experiencia trabajando en ecosistemas de datos de AWS
Sólida experiencia en Cloud (AWS). Valorable experiencia con Azure o GCP
Sólida experiencia en Python y PySpark procesando grandes volúmenes de datos
Experiencia en la creación de data pipelines (CI/CD)
Experiencia en la implementación de modelos de ML listos para producción, utilizando técnicas actuales de ML/Deep learning
Experiencia con tecnología MLOps
Experiencia con herramientas de control de versiones de código fuente
Conocimiento en bases de datos SQL y NoSQL
Experiencia en testing
Nivel alto de inglés
Team player
Nice to have: Experiencia en Power BI // Experiencia con herramientas como Terraform, Bicep o similares




Benefits




¿Qué Ofrecemos?:




Salario acorde al mercado y tu experiencia 🤑
Horario flexible 35 horas / semana 😎 (sin reducción de salario)
Trabajo remoto 100% (opcional) 🌍
Retribución flexible (restaurante, transporte y guardería) ✌
Seguro médico y dental (totalmente gratuito para el empleado) 🚑
Presupuesto individual para formación ycertificaciones de Microsoft gratuitas 📚
Clases de inglés (1 hora a la semana) 🗽
Día libre por tu cumpleaños 🌴🥳
Bonus mensual en concepto de electricidad e internet en casa 💻
Descuento en plan de gimnasio y actividades deportivas 🔝
Plain Camp (evento anual de team building) 🎪




➕ El gusto de trabajar siempre con las últimas herramientas tecnológicas.




Con toda esta info ya conoces mucho de nosotros, ¿nos dejas que conozcamos más de ti?




¿El proceso de selección? – Sencillo, 3 pasos: una llamada y 2 entrevistas con el equipo 🤘




Y te preguntarás… ¿Quién es Plain Concepts?




Plain Concepts somos más de 400 personas apasionadas por la tecnología, movidas por el cambio hacia la búsqueda de las mejores soluciones para nuestros clientes y proyectos.




A lo largo de estos años, la empresa ha crecido gracias al gran potencial técnico que tenemos dentro y apoyándonos siempre en nuestras ideas más locas e innovadoras. Contamos con más de 14 oficinas en 6 países diferentes. Nuestro objetivo principal es seguir creciendo como equipo, realizando los mejores y más avanzados proyectos en el mercado.




Realmente creemos en la importancia de reunir personas de diferentes ámbitos y países para formar el mejor equipo, con una cultura plural e inclusiva.




¿Qué hacemos en Plain?




Nos caracterizamos por tener un ADN 100% técnico. Desarrollamos proyectos a medida desde 0, consultorías técnicas y formación💜




No hacemos bodyshopping ni outsorcing
Nuestros equipos son multidisciplinares y la estructura de organización es plana y horizontal
Muy comprometidos con los valores AGILE
Vivir es compartir, nos ayudamos, apoyamos y animamos mutuamente para ampliar nuestros conocimientos internamente y también de cara a la comunidad (con conferencias, eventos, charlas..)
Siempre buscamos la creatividad e innovación, incluso cuando la idea es una locura para otros
La transparencia, clave para cualquier relación




Hacemos realidad las ideas y soluciones de nuestros clientes con un alto grado de excelencia técnica, para más información visita nuestra web:




➡ https://www.plainconcepts.com/es/casos-estudio/




En Plain Concepts, sin duda, buscamos ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades. Queremos solicitantes con diversidad sin importar la raza, color, género, religión, nacionalidad, ciudadanía, discapacidad, edad, orientación sexual o cualquier otra característica protegida por la ley.

Title: Big Data Engineer (100% remoto)
text:
🚀 Sectorea somos una compañía de atracción de talento especializada en selección de perfiles digitales. Somos partners de clientes líderes en el sector, especialistas en innovación, desarrollo de software, productos digitales, inteligencia artificial, entidades bancarias, ¡y mucho más!




En este momento, estamos buscando un Big Data Engineer con +3 años de experiencia para trabajar 100% remoto con una empresa de tecnología y consultoría internacional 👨🏻‍💻🌍




¿Qué necesitas para unirte al equipo?

Más de 3 años de experiencia como Big Data/Data Engineer
Experiencia trabajando con Scala y Spark
Experiencia y conocimientos en Hive y HDFS




¿Qué te ofrecen?

Contrato indefinido 📝✅
Salario competitivo en función de la experiencia
Horario flexible y 100% en remoto 🌍
Jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano hasta las 15:00h
Seguro médico privado 🩺
Retribución flexible
Oportunidades de crecimiento y desarrollo.




¡Te esperamos!

Title: Junior Data Engineer (initiativ)
text:
Dies ist eine INITIATIVBEWERBUNG! Bewirb dich jetzt über talentbase .tech ...




und wähle bis zu 35 Partner-Unternehmen aus, an welche wir dein Profil für eine DATA ENGINEER Stelle weiterleiten.




Aufgaben




Datenextraktion, Transformation und Laden (ETL) von verschiedenen Datenquellen.
Unterstützung bei der Entwicklung und Pflege von Datenpipelines.
Datenspeicherung und -verwaltung in Datenbanken oder Data Warehouses.
Mitarbeit bei der Datentransformation und -bereinigung.
Überwachung und Wartung von Datenverarbeitungsprozessen.





Qualifikation




Programmierkenntnisse in Sprachen wie Python, Java oder Scala
Verständnis der grundlegenden Datenbankkonzepte und -technologien
Erfahrung mit Big-Data-Frameworks wie Hadoop oder Spark

Vertrautheit mit SQL und grundlegendes Verständnis von NoSQL-Datenbanken
Problemlösungsfähigkeiten und analytisches Denkvermögen
Teamfähigkeit und die Fähigkeit, effektiv in einem dynamischen Umfeld zu arbeiten
Aufmerksamkeit für Detail und Genauigkeit bei der Datenverarbeitung
Grundlegende Kenntnisse in der Arbeit mit Cloud-Plattformen wie AWS, GCP oder Azure





Dies ist eine Stelle von talentbase .tech!




Profil erstellen und Daten ausfüllen
Coole Unternehmen finden

Achtung: 1-Klick Initiativbewerbungen sind momentan nur für Österreichische und EU-Staatsbürger:innen, sowie Personen mit Sitz in Österreich verfügbar.

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d)
text:
Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt zur Erweiterung unseres Data Teams einen weiteren Data Engineer.




We are looking to expand our Data Team with an additional Data Engineer who can start as soon as possible.




Aufgaben




Du pflegst und erweiterst unsere Datenpipelines und unser Datawarehouse
Du liebst es, Datenprodukte in Zusammenarbeit mit Datenanalysten und Data Scientists zu entwerfen, zu entwickeln und zu pflegen
Du integrierst neue Datenquellen und restrukturierst unsere aktuellen Datenpipelines, um die Performance und Skalierbarkeit zu verbessern
Du arbeitest mit unseren Data Engineers zusammen, um ein Data Monitoring zu entwickeln, um die Zuverlässigkeit und Qualität unserer Daten zu verbessern
Du arbeitest mit unseren Data Scientists zusammen, um eine Recommendation Engine, die wir von Grund auf neu erstellen, zu erweitern und zu skalieren
You will maintain and expand our data pipelines and our data warehouse
You love to design, develop and maintain data products in collaboration with Data Analysts and Data Scientists
You will Integrate new data sources and restructure our current data pipelines to improve performance and scalability
You will collaborate with our Data Engineers to develop a Data Monitoring system to improve the reliability and quality of our data
You will collaborate with our Data Scientists to expand and scale a Recommendation Engine that we are building from scratch




Qualifikation




3-4 Jahre Erfahrung im Aufbau und der Pflege von Data Warehouses und der Durchführung von Data Modeling
Sehr starke SQL- und Python-Kenntnisse (unser aktueller ETL-Stack besteht aus SQL-Skripten, die von mara-etl ausgeführt werden - einem Python-basierten ETL-Framework)
Du arbeitest gerne im Team und führst Projekte in fokussierten, inkrementellen Schritten durch
fließend Englisch und Deutsch (~B2 für beide ist ausreichend)
3-4 years experience building and maintaining data warehouses and performing data modeling
Very strong SQL and Python skills (our current ETL stack consists of SQL scripts executed by mara-etl, a lightweight Python-based ETL framework)
You enjoy working in a team, and completing projects in focused, incremental steps
Reasonably fluent in English and German (~B2 for both is acceptable)




Benefits




Gesundheit – Wir leben unser Produkt. Daher stellen wir dir ein jährliches Budget für Gesundheitskurse sowie -equipment zur Verfügung
Work-Life-Balance – Du erhältst einen unbefristetet Arbeitsvertrag, 28 Tage Urlaub p.a. + 1 Tag für ehrenamtliche Tätigkeiten, flexible Arbeitszeiten. Ein selbst bestimmtes Hybrid-Arbeitsmodell (remote oder Office) bieten dir die Möglichkeit, einen Ausgleich zwischen Berufs- und Privatleben zu schaffen
Teamspirit – Unser passioniertes Team freut sich schon auf dich. Durch regelmäßige Teamevents stärken wir unsere Bindung und Zusammenarbeit
Health - We are living our product. That is why we offer you a budget to be used for health and fitness courses as well as equipment
Work-Life-Balance - You receive an unlimited contract, 28 days of vacation plus 1 day for community service and flexible working hours. An individual working modell (remote or at the office) offers you the opportunity to find a balance between working and private life.
Team Spirit - Our passionate team is eager to meet you. We strengthen our bond and cooperation through regular team events.

Title: Data Engineer
text:
PASO SOLUTIONS ist ein aufstrebendes und schnell wachsendes Unternehmen mit Standorten in Hohenzell, Graz und Landau in der Pfalz. Wir sind ein agiles Team bestehend aus engagierten Solutions Consultants, Architects und Engineers. Gemeinsam entwickeln wir individuelle Business Analytics & Software Lösungen für unsere langjährigen nationalen und internationalen Kunden in den Bereichen Automotive und Anlagenbau und treiben innovative Technologien voran.




Du bist stolz ein DATA ENGINEER zu sein? Wir auch! Entwickle mit uns gemeinsam Data Warehouses, Business Intelligence und Analytics Lösungen. Werde ab sofort in VZ ein Teil unseres engagierten Teams in Hohenzell oder Graz als




Senior Data Engineer




für Data Warehouses, Business Intelligence und Analytics (m,w,d)




Aufgaben




Entwicklung von Data Warehouses, Business Intelligence und Analytics Lösungen
Sammeln, generieren und auswählen von relevanten Daten in Quellsystemen
Modellieren der Daten für die effiziente Speicherung und schnelle Abfrage
Aufbereitung von Daten und Berechnung von Kennzahlen für Berichte und Dashboards
Verantwortung über eigene Arbeitspakete bzw. anteiliges Projektmanagement
Entwicklung von Schnittstellen für Daten- und Systemintegration





Qualifikation




Interesse an Data Engineering, Data Analytics und Data Science
Idealerweise einschlägige Ausbildung oder vergleichbare Berufserfahrung
Kenntnisse in SQL und Datenbanken (z.B. SQL Server, T-SQL)
Erfahrungen mit DWH und BI von Vorteil (z.B. ETL, SSIS/SSAS/SSRS, Power BI)
Bereitschaft zum ständigen Lernen und zur fachlichen Weiterbildung
Kommunikative Persönlichkeit, Flexibilität und Lösungsorientierung
Gute Deutschkenntnisse und Teamspirit





Benefits




Spannende Projekte und Herausforderungen passend zu deinem technischen Skillset
Hohe gestalterische Möglichkeiten, breites Aufgabengebiet und selbstbestimmtes





Arbeiten nach deinen Wünschen
Mitgestaltung in einem selbstgesteuerten Team aus stolzen Data Engineers
Freie Zeiteinteilung (Gleitzeit ohne Kernzeit, Home-Office an bis zu drei Tagen)
Individuell auf dich zugeschnittene Weiterbildung (Kurse, Zertifikate, Workshops, …)





Abhängig von deiner Berufserfahrung beginnt das kollektiv-vertragliche Mindestgehalt




(IT-Kollektivvertrag, ST1) bei € 2.589 für Berufseinsteiger bzw. bei € 3.190




mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung. Selbstverständlich bieten wir dir eine




attraktive Überzahlung entsprechend deiner Qualifikationen. Gerne erzählen wir




dir bei einem persönlichen Gespräch mehr von uns. Sende uns deinen Lebenslauf




und Kontaktdaten. Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Title: Software Engineer
text:
Description




We would absolutely love to speak to the best Software Engineers who are interested in a new role.




LYTT is a growing technology start up backed by bp and we need a mid-senior Software Engineers to help us evolve our real-time, streaming data processing and visualization platforms.




We are looking for a brilliant, well-rounded person to help us evolve and deliver our product strategy for our next stage of growth (which includes moving into adjacent markets, such as renewables).




Here is our tech stack - https://stackshare.io/lytt-com/lytt




Responsibilities:




Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve features for our real-time data visualization platform.
Help in design and architecting our software for performance and scale.
Work collaboratively with designers and engineers in cross functional teams where software is product led, design driven, data informed and customer centric.
Take ownership of your tasks and see features through from start to finish.
Mentor, coach and foster good working practices that elevate our software ecosystem
Understand the whole product, its modules, and the interrelationship between them
Participation in LYTT’s on-call policy for solution delivery support as needed




Requirements




It would be fantastic if you have most (not ALL) of these characteristics or experiences:




Proficiency with Typescript and/or Python.
Design and development of modern web applications with emphasis on micro-services architecture and design patterns.
Building backend services (Node.js, express or equivalent) and their communication protocols (GraphQL, RESTful or gRPC).
Containers and cloud environments (Docker, AWS, ECS, or equivalent Google Cloud, Azure, etc.).
Databases - RDBMS (Postgres) and/or NoSQL databases.
CI/CD (Gitlab CI/CD or equivalent CircleCI, Jenkins, etc.).
Exposure to IaC (Pulumi or equivalent Terraform etc.).
A track record of operating within a successful Agile team.




Extra points if




High-level development languages (Python, Golang, Java)
Data streaming, event sourcing, or message brokers.
Monitoring and tracing software (Sentry, or equivalent).
Experience with Hasura




We know that sometimes people can be put off applying for a job if they don’t think they can tick every box, but we realize that the ‘perfect candidate’ does not exist. If you are excited about working with us and can do most of what we are looking for, go ahead and apply. You could be exactly what we need!




Benefits




Flexible working
We're happy for you to be fully remote within Portugal
25 days annual leave
A (genuine) commitment to wellness
Enhanced parental leave
Annual bonus
A brilliant team, who care

Title: Data Warehouse Testing Engineer
text:
About ALTEN Romania




ALTEN Romania, part of the international ALTEN Group - with a unique position as a Leader in IT & Engineering Consulting- has provided support for its clients’ development strategies in innovation, R&D, and IT systems since 1996. The company comprises 2 divisions specialized in its core capabilities: ENGINEERING & IT. These two divisions are ALTEN TECHNO & ALTEN KEPLER.




ALTEN Romania is part of the ALTEN Group, an IT and Engineering Consulting leader. We develop innovative and durable technical solutions that fulfill the needs of our local and international partners.




Key Responsibilities:




Testing and approving all ETL processes/DB scripts/critical reports before deployment in production
Building testing scripts/simulations according to design documents
Creating detailed functional software test plans
Troubleshooting and identifying the root cause of identified issues
Working closely with QA & development teams in both RO & IL
Working in Agile methodology




Required Technical Skills:




Experience in writing SQL queries & scripts
Experience in DWH testing – data quality tests, testing scripts, STD documents, reading and analyzing product & dev documents
Experience in SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services) – an advantage
Experience working with Snowflake – an advantage
Experience working in Agile methodology - an advantage.
Highly motivated and independent.
Good English communication skills







*Only eligible candidates will be contacted in a maximum of 2 weeks. Any information provided is treated as confidential.

Title: Data Software Engineer Greece
Data Analyst
text:
BARKYN’S VISION




Barkyn delivers health and happiness to pet families around the world.




We are an ambitious, forward thinking startup on a big mission! We’re not only changing the pet market, we’re also reshaping the way the e-commerce experience should feel - human, personalized, seamless, & beautiful. We were considered one of Europe’s Top 100 Startups by Wired, Top Startup by Linkedin, and a success case by Web Summit and the British magazine Monocle.




THE ROLE




We're creating a loved brand in Europe and this is where your story starts!




As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our organization, immersing yourself in data to uncover opportunities for improving our current and future Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). Working closely with the product, marketing, and operational teams, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth. Your responsibilities will include developing customized data studio reporting, creating and supporting analytical models, and delivering meaningful information to stakeholders through SQL and business intelligence (BI) tools.




Specifically, we expect you to:




Dive deep into data to identify areas for improvement in our KPIs.
Collaborate closely with product, marketing, and operational teams to deliver valuable insights.
Develop customized data studio reporting for various business areas.
Generate custom reports using SQL and BI tools to provide actionable information to stakeholders.
Create and support analytical models to gain insights into customer behavior.





Mandatory requirements:




Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
2+ years of relevant experience as a Business Analyst or Data Analyst.
Proficiency in SQL.
Experience using data visualization tools such as Data Studio, Looker, PowerBI, Tableau, or similar.
Passion for generating data-driven insights.
Fluency in written and spoken English.





Brownie Points:




Knowledge of statistical programming languages like R and/or Python.
Startup Environment Experience.
Dog Owner.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
text:
Company Name: The Swedish Times- Newbies are welcome to Apply




Job Type: Full-time/Remote




Salary: $4,000.00 - $5,000.00 per month




The Swedish Times is a top online platform for professionals and enthusiasts who want to stay informed about the Swedish business, financial, and tech sectors. We also cover international news related to business and technology. Our goal is to be the go-to place for people who want timely updates and useful information about these industries. Visit The Swedish Times to stay connected and up-to-date with the professional world.




We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our team. As a Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in assisting with data analysis tasks, data cleaning, and reporting under the guidance of senior analysts. This is an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience and develop your analytical skills in a professional setting.




If you're interested, we would love to have you join our team! Visit our website at [theswedishtimes dot com] to find out more information. We require you to send us your CV and a cover letter that highlights why you would be a perfect fit for our team. We can't wait to hear from you!




Tasks




Responsibilities:




Assist in collecting, organizing, and cleaning data from various sources.
Visit the website of The Swedish Times [theswedishtimes dot com] to familiarize yourself with the process.
Perform data analysis using statistical techniques and data visualization tools. Support the creation of reports and presentations to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Collaborate with team members to identify data quality issues and propose solutions.
Help in maintaining and updating data documentation and databases.
Conduct research and stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis.





Requirements




Qualifications:




Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science) or equivalent practical experience.
Basic understanding of data analysis concepts and techniques.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Proficiency in data manipulation and cleaning tasks.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar is a plus.





Benefits




Competitive Compensation: We believe in recognizing the value and contributions of our employees by offering competitive salaries and compensation packages.
Comprehensive Health Coverage: We prioritize the health and welfare of our employees by providing comprehensive health insurance plans that cover medical, dental, and vision expenses.
Generous Leave Policies: We understand the importance of work-life balance and offer generous leave policies, including vacation days, personal days, and parental leave, to ensure our employees have time for rest, relaxation, and personal commitments.
Professional Development: We support the growth and advancement of our employees through various professional development programs, training opportunities, and educational assistance initiatives. We believe in investing in our employees' skills and knowledge.
Employee Assistance Programs: We care about the well-being of our employees and provide access to employee assistance programs that offer counseling, mental health support, and resources for personal and professional challenges.
Flexible Work Arrangements: We recognize the importance of flexibility and strive to offer flexible work arrangements, such as remote work options or flexible scheduling, to accommodate individual needs and promote work-life balance.
Recognition and Rewards: We value the hard work and achievements of our employees and have recognition and rewards programs in place to acknowledge their contributions and motivate continued excellence.
Inclusive and Diverse Environment: We foster an inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees feel valued, respected, and have equal opportunities for growth and advancement.
Social and Community Engagement: We encourage employees to participate in social and community engagement activities, such as volunteering initiatives, to give back to society and create a positive impact.





We welcome individuals of all nationalities with open arms. No matter where you're from, you have the opportunity to be a part of our awesome team. For further information regarding the job position and to gain a better understanding, we encourage you to visit our website.

Title: Software Development Engineer
text:
LivePerson (NASDAQ: LPSN) is a global leader in trustworthy and equal AI for business. Hundreds of the world’s leading brands — including HSBC, Chipotle, and Virgin Media — use our Conversational Cloud platform to engage with millions of consumers safely and responsibly. We power a billion conversational interactions every month, providing a uniquely rich data set and safety tools to unlock the power of Generative AI and Large Language Models for better business outcomes.




At LivePerson, we foster an inclusive workplace culture that encourages meaningful connection, collaboration, and innovation. Every mind is invited to ask questions and actively seek new ways to achieve success and reach their full potential. We operate as one with a growth mindset. This means spotting opportunities, solving ambiguities and seeking effective solutions to challenges that make things better.




Overview




We are at the forefront of developing state-of-the-art Large Language Models (LLMs) for business. As a Software Engineer specialized in Large Language Models, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining robust systems that streamline the management of these models throughout their lifecycle. Your expertise will ensure the efficient fine-tuning of models, seamless model serving, and smooth integration into our core product.




You Will




Model Lifecycle Management: Design and implement systems to facilitate the end-to-end management of Large Language Models. This includes versioning, tracking changes, and ensuring proper documentation of model configurations and performance.
Model Fine-Tuning: Collaborate with NLP researchers and data scientists to implement fine-tuning pipelines that optimize model performance on specific tasks or domains. Enable efficient experimentation with different training data and hyperparameters.
Model Serving Infrastructure: Develop scalable and reliable infrastructure for serving LLMs in real-world applications. Ensure high availability, low latency, and effective resource allocation to handle production-level demands.
Application Integration: Design and build libraries and tools to help integrate LLMs into a variety of applications and services. Collaborate with application development teams to ensure smooth integration.
Continuous Integration and Deployment: Implement robust CI/CD pipelines for model deployment and updates. Automate testing and validation processes to maintain model accuracy and reliability in production environments.
Model Monitoring and Analytics: Develop monitoring solutions to track model performance, usage patterns, and potential issues. Utilize metrics and logs to identify opportunities for model improvement and optimize resource utilization.
Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including NLP researchers, machine learning engineers, product managers, and DevOps, to align goals, exchange ideas, and deliver high-quality solutions.
Research and Innovation: Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in NLP, model lifecycle management, and Large Language Models. Participate in research discussions and propose innovative approaches to improve model capabilities and management processes.




You Have




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
3+ years of software development industry experience
Strong programming skills in Python
Experience with cloud platforms and containerization technologies (e.g., GCP, Docker, Kubernetes).
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in a team-oriented setting.




Preferred Qualifications




Familiarity with frameworks like PyTorch, HuggingFace Transformers and DeepSpeed. Experience with large-scale model training and optimization.
Solid understanding of NLP concepts and model architectures.
Contributions to open-source NLP or machine learning projects.
Prior experience with state-of-the-art Large Language Models, and their lifecycle management.




Benefits




Health: medical, dental, and vision
Time away: vacation and holidays
Development: Native AI learning and Fast track growth opportunities
Equal opportunity employer




Why You’ll Love Working Here




LivePerson is a hub for the ever-curious and proactive, offering a flexible work-life balance tailored to individual needs. With offices and WeWork locations worldwide, our flexible work policy provides our teams the freedom to work from their preferred environment. We're very proud to have earned recognition from Fast Company, Newsweek, and BuiltIn for being a top innovative, beloved, and remote-friendly workplace.




Belonging at LivePerson




We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.




We are committed to the accessibility needs of applicants and employees. We provide reasonable accommodations to job applicants with physical or mental disabilities. Applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should inform their recruiting contact upon initial connection.

Title: Software Development Engineer
text:
LivePerson (NASDAQ: LPSN) is a global leader in trustworthy and equal AI for business. Hundreds of the world’s leading brands — including HSBC, Chipotle, and Virgin Media — use our Conversational Cloud platform to engage with millions of consumers safely and responsibly. We power a billion conversational interactions every month, providing a uniquely rich data set and safety tools to unlock the power of Generative AI and Large Language Models for better business outcomes.




At LivePerson, we foster an inclusive workplace culture that encourages meaningful connection, collaboration, and innovation. Every mind is invited to ask questions and actively seek new ways to achieve success and reach their full potential. We operate as one with a growth mindset. This means spotting opportunities, solving ambiguities and seeking effective solutions to challenges that make things better.




Overview




We are at the forefront of developing state-of-the-art Large Language Models (LLMs) for business. As a Software Engineer specialized in Large Language Models, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining robust systems that streamline the management of these models throughout their lifecycle. Your expertise will ensure the efficient fine-tuning of models, seamless model serving, and smooth integration into our core product.




You Will




Model Lifecycle Management: Design and implement systems to facilitate the end-to-end management of Large Language Models. This includes versioning, tracking changes, and ensuring proper documentation of model configurations and performance.
Model Fine-Tuning: Collaborate with NLP researchers and data scientists to implement fine-tuning pipelines that optimize model performance on specific tasks or domains. Enable efficient experimentation with different training data and hyperparameters.
Model Serving Infrastructure: Develop scalable and reliable infrastructure for serving LLMs in real-world applications. Ensure high availability, low latency, and effective resource allocation to handle production-level demands.
Application Integration: Design and build libraries and tools to help integrate LLMs into a variety of applications and services. Collaborate with application development teams to ensure smooth integration.
Continuous Integration and Deployment: Implement robust CI/CD pipelines for model deployment and updates. Automate testing and validation processes to maintain model accuracy and reliability in production environments.
Model Monitoring and Analytics: Develop monitoring solutions to track model performance, usage patterns, and potential issues. Utilize metrics and logs to identify opportunities for model improvement and optimize resource utilization.
Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including NLP researchers, machine learning engineers, product managers, and DevOps, to align goals, exchange ideas, and deliver high-quality solutions.
Research and Innovation: Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in NLP, model lifecycle management, and Large Language Models. Participate in research discussions and propose innovative approaches to improve model capabilities and management processes.




You Have




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
2 years of software development industry experience
Strong programming skills.
Experience with cloud platforms and containerization technologies (e.g., GCP, Docker, Kubernetes).
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in a team-oriented setting.




Preferred Qualifications




Familiarity with frameworks like PyTorch, HuggingFace Transformers and DeepSpeed. Experience with large-scale model training and optimization.
Solid understanding of NLP concepts and model architectures.
Contributions to open-source NLP or machine learning projects.
Prior experience with state-of-the-art Large Language Models, and their lifecycle management.




Benefits




Health: medical, dental, and vision
Time away: vacation and holidays
Development: Native AI learning and Fast track growth opportunities
Equal opportunity employer




Why You’ll Love Working Here




LivePerson is a hub for the ever-curious and proactive, offering a flexible work-life balance tailored to individual needs. With offices and WeWork locations worldwide, our flexible work policy provides our teams the freedom to work from their preferred environment. We're very proud to have earned recognition from Fast Company, Newsweek, and BuiltIn for being a top innovative, beloved, and remote-friendly workplace.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x)
text:
At commercetools, we are:




Engaged: We didn't become the fastest growing, highest ever valued SaaS software company in digital commerce with nearly 100% year-over-year growth by sitting on the sidelines.




Inspired: We continually explore what's possible. As the founder of the headless commerce concept, the leader in true composable commerce, and the visionaries behind MACH® — our patented tech has radically disrupted the world of enterprise ecommerce software. And we are just getting started!




Valued: Intelligent, resilient, passionate individuals hailing from over 50 countries across the globe, speaking over 43 languages, and collectively embracing diversity, encouraging inclusion, and fostering a culture of care.




The Opportunity:




commercetools encourages critical thinking and data-driven decision-making. To support our data strategy, we are hiring an experienced Data Analyst who really enjoys building things from scratch! Essentially, you will act as a catalyst for change in how commercetools stores, processes and utilizes data. Our ultimate goal is to create new dashboards and reports using Tableau to provide a user-friendly and intuitive experience to our internal users.




Please note that for this role, we can currently hire candidates based in the following countries: Austria, France, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Spain, and the United Kingdom.




Your Mission:




Designing and implementing our BI solution (Tableau) and ensuring that all data protection requirements are met
Supporting Data Engineers on planning and developing new data models that allow user-friendly, customized reporting
Supporting the various international business units by giving them access to BI solutions tailored for their needs
Creating customized dashboards based on those data models
Driving the right strategy to continuously increase dashboard performance




What you need to succeed:




Around 3-5 years professional experience in the field of Business Intelligence on the Analysis and Administration side
A proven track record of successfully implementing and administrating BI reports using Tableau
Experience in managing complex BI projects
Sound knowledge of query and data manipulation languages e.g. SQL, etc.
Good understanding of data structures and data management
Strong analytical thinking skills
A naturally proactive approach with the ability to bring new ideas to fruition in a solution-oriented way
Fluency in English




Nice to have:




Knowledge on Google Cloud Platform solutions, basic Python




We Care About Your Growth And Well-being




☀️ Remote Work: Up to 60 days/year from a country different from your base country




💻 Open Learning & Development Budget




📚 ct Academy: Regular internal training sessions




🙌 Our Benefits: Check them out here




⌚️ Flexibility: Morning person or night owl? We believe in outcome and motivated employees




🚀 Mindset & Growth: A diverse workspace with an open, international culture & learning environment




Are you ready? Come grow with us!




🔍 Are you looking for something else? Check out our Career Page and our Website for more information.




We are all different and that is what makes us stronger! We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company better.




commercetools celebrates being a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunities employer. If your professional profile aligns with our specific hiring requirements and company culture, then we encourage you to apply. We will assess your competencies, future potential, approach to learning and self-development and passion, and not your age, color, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, familial status, genetics, or disability.

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d)
text:
Über uns

Das ist Ihre Chance für Ihren nächsten Einsatz. Sie suchen anspruchsvolle Projekte bei spannenden Kunden? Sie wünschen sich Flexibilität in der Auslastung? Sie suchen einen verlässlichen Partner in der Projektsuche, -beratung und -abwicklung? Dann suchen wir Sie! Kompetent, persönlich und initiativ - das ist die top itservices AG: Als einer der führenden Personaldienstleister für IT bringen wir top Fach- und Führungskräfte sowie Spezialisten zum passenden Unternehmen. Wir nehmen uns Zeit, Sie kennenzulernen, navigieren Sie auf Wunsch durch Ihre Freiberuflichkeit und bringen Sie punktgenau zu Ihren passenden Einsätzen. Mit uns sind Sie Freiberufler auf höchstem Niveau.

Nehmen Sie die Herausforderung an und besetzen Sie zusammen mit uns gemeinsam folgendes Projekt als Data Engineer (m/w/d).

Ihre Aufgaben

Auswertung und Visualisierung von Daten zur kommunalen Wärmeplanung
Erstellung von Zeitreihen aus Daten aus verschiedenen Quellsystemen
Übertragung der Daten und Zeitreihen in ein neues Datenmodell, das aus einer Graph-Datenbank besteht
Verarbeitung der Daten mit Python zur Erstellung von Graphstrukturen

Was Sie mitbringen sollten

Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Mathematik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Praktische Erfahrung in der Entwicklung mit Python sowie in der Erstellung von Zeitreihen und in den Bereichen Datenanalyse und Data Engineering
Know-how in der Arbeit mit Git, Pandas, NetworkX, Polars und Spark
Expertise in agilen Projektmethoden und in Continuous Integration und Continuous Development
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Was wir Ihnen bieten

Individuell und kurzfristig gestaltbare Zahlungsziele
Volle örtliche Flexibilität 100% Remote Work
Vertrauensvolle & persönliche Begleitung zu jeder Zeit – Partnerschaftlichkeit ist die Basis unserer Zusammenarbeit
Transparenter und schneller Bewerbungsprozess mit einer verbindlichen Rückmeldung binnen 14 Tagen
Compliance Expertise zur rechtskonformen Projektdurchführung und Vermeidung von Risiken der Scheinselbstständigkeit

Bewerben

Erkennen Sie sich wieder? Dann senden Sie Ihre Unterlagen unter Angabe der Kennziffer 221-4435 an Herrn Maurice Geiß. Erste Informationswünsche und Fragen beantwortet Ihnen Maurice Geiß gern telefonisch unter +49 30 2014497-32. Wir freuen uns bald von Ihnen zu hören!

Title: Data Engineer in der Unternehmensberatung
text:
Als Data Engineer bist Du zentral für den Produkterfolg. Ein Grundstein dafür sind die Skalierbarkeit und die Sicherheit unserer Analyseplattform.




Unsere selbstentwickelte Analyseplattform premergency bietet folgende Funktionen:




Verschiedene Backend Services
Eigene Routing engine und Risiko-Algorithmen in skalierbarer Worker-Architektur




Im Bereich Consulting arbeiten wir mit namhaften Kunden aus Handel, Chemie, Manufacturing und Public Security an geobasierten Datenarchitekturen und Innovationsprojekten.




Aufgaben




Weiterentwicklung unserer Softwarearchitektur und Cloudplattform im Software-Team
Weiterentwicklung unserer Backend-Services
Ableitung von Tools aus den Beratungsprojekten für Wiederverwendbarkeit und Skalierung
Datenaufbereitung in unseren Beratungsprojekten (Big Data Management)




Qualifikation




Master in Mathematik, Informatik, Physik oder einer verwandten Disziplin mit Software-Fokus.
gute Erfahrung in Softwarearchitektur - Du solltest relevante Autoren und Gestaltungsmuster kennen,
Gute Kenntnisse des Spring Framework (v5), zusätzliches Interesse an neuen Technologien wie GoLang
Grundkenntnisse in Python und Bereitschaft Pipelines, Worker, etc. in Python statt Java zu schreiben, auch wenn Java in unserem Backend Stack vorherrscht.
Gute Kenntnisse in mindestens einem ETL oder Tool zur Datenverarbeitung (e.g. Apache Airflow, Apache Beam, Spring Dataflow, Kedro)
Begeisterung und Kenntnisse von Docker / Kubernetes oder sich in diese reinzuarbeiten
Gute Fertigkeiten in SQL-2011 und Erfahrungen in PostgreSQL
Kenntnisse von MPP Datenbanken wie Spark 2.0 oder Exasol runden Dein Profil ab
Kenntnisse in Scrum und User Stories sind willkommen (ACs, Task-breakdown etc.),
Bereitschaft eine Prüfung zur Zertifizierung als Google Professional Cloud Data Engineer in der Probezeit zu absolvieren
Wir erwarten, dass Du fließend Englisch sprichst (UniCert C1 or C2)
Bereitschaft an Beratungsprojekten mitzuarbeiten und zupackend zu arbeiten




Benefits




überdurchschnittliche Vergütung
natürlich Hardware fürs Home Office
Förderung von Women in Tech und Women Techmakers,
kostenlose, warme und kalte Getränke,
Obstkorb & Snacks für den Vitaminhaushalt,
monatlicher Gutschein fürs Fitnessstudio oder Sportverein,
lernende Organisation - kostenlose Fortbildungskurse von Coursera und eigene Fachbibliothek aber auch externe Fortbildungen,
Jobticket oder Tiefgaragenstellplatz auf Wunsch,
Firmenfahrrad für Pendler auf Wunsch,
vermögenswirksame Leistungen des Arbeitgebers.




Arbeitsatmosphäre




spannende Kunden und Projekte
flexible Arbeitszeiten und -konten
eigene Produktentwicklung aus Big Data und Algorithmik
lockere Arbeitsatmosphäre in einem jungen, innovativen aber sehr erfahrenen Team
sehr erfahrenes Team




Arbeitsplatz




300m von der Stadtbahnhaltestelle Hürth-Efferen entfernt, Bushaltestelle direkt vor der Tür; 20min zum Flughafen, 20min zum ICE-Bahnhof
voll Remote-fähig
neuester Laptop, 27″ Displays
Ergonomischer Arbeitsplatz mit höhenverstellbarem Schreibtisch und Tageslichtlampen
sonnendurchflutete Büros (im Sommer Klimatisierung und Verschattung)




Passt alles? Prima. Dann sende uns schnell Deinen Lebenslauf und optional ein aussagekräftiges Anschreiben!




Wir freuen uns Dich kennenzulernen!

Title: Software Engineer
text:
Are you a recent Master's or PhD graduate (or graduating in 2023/early 2024)?!




We are currently partnered with a company with a proven track record of providing high-quality technology solutions to businesses. They are looking for talented & motivated Software Engineers to join their team.




This will give you the opportunity to work across several exciting agile SW development projects within multiple domains such as automotive, e-commerce, aerospace, logistics, finance &more!




They are looking for people with/due to receive excellent grades from their Master's or PhD, coupled with good coding experience.




As a Software Engineer your skills will include:




· Master’s degree in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics or STEM subjects;

· PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics or STEM subjects;

· Experience in agile software development; private or open-source projects

· Solid proficiency in one or more programming languages; e.g. C, C++, Python, JavaScript, PHP, Scala

· B2/C1 level German language




Feel free to also refer someone you may know who could be good for the role. If they are successfully placed, we offer a great referral scheme!




Key words - Programming / Open-source / Computer Science / Graduates / Post-Graduates / PhD / Coding / Automotive / E-commerce/ Aerospace / Defense / Logistics / Finance / AI / Agile / Software Development / Software Engineering




By applying to this role, you understand that we may collect your personal data and store and process it on our systems. For more information please see our Privacy Notice (https://eu-recruit.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Privacy-Notice.pdf).

Title: Junior System Engineer - Linux (m/w/d)
text:
dynexo, ein Unternehmen der DISION Technologies Group, ist spezialisiert auf IT- und Cyber-Security-Lösungen.




Mit einem erfahrenen Team aus Experten bieten wir unseren Kunden individuelle Beratung und maßgeschneiderte Lösungen, um ihre IT-Infrastruktur sicher und geschützt zu halten.




Von der Netzwerksicherheit bis hin zur Cloud-Sicherheit bieten wir ein breites Spektrum an Dienstleistungen, Rund um Security, Informationssicherheit und Datenschutz.




Gemeinsam mit unseren Entwicklungsteams stellen wir sicher, dass Anwendungen, Dienste und Systeme sicher sind und den neuesten Industriestandards entsprechen.




Aufgaben




Wir suchen einen motivierten Junior System Engineer, der sich auf Linux Betriebssysteme und Digitalisierung spezialisiert hat und unser Team bei dynexo unterstützen möchte!




Als System Engineer bei dynexo wirst du verantwortlich sein für die Implementierung und Wartung von Anwendungen, Systemen und Servern, On-Premises und in der Cloud.




Du wirst auch eng mit unseren Entwicklern zusammenarbeiten, Playbooks und Routinen entwicklen, um sicherzustellen, dass unsere Anwendungen sicher sind und den neuesten Industriestandards entsprechen.




Um erfolgreich in dieser Rolle zu sein, solltest du ein Verständnis für Linux Systeme, idealerweise auf Basis von RedHat, Ubuntu und Debian haben, sowie Erfahrung in der Implementierung von Lösungen in Cloud-Umgebungen.




Du solltest auch Erfahrung in der Verwendung von Automatisierungswerkzeugen haben, um sicherzustellen, dass unsere Systeme und Anwendungen verfügbar und ständig geschützt sind.




Zu deinen Aufgaben gehören:




Aufbau und Konfiguration von IT-Systemen, On-Premises und in der Cloud
Entwicklung und Weiterentwicklung von IT-Systemen
Mitwirken an Projekten mit IT-Schwerpunkt
Unterstützung bei der Umsetzung von IT-Lösungen
Fehleranalyse und Troubleshooting




Qualifikation




Studium in der Informatik, Ausbildung oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Kenntnisse und Erfahrung im Umgang mit IT-Systemen
Kenntnisse zu Microsoft Betriebssystemen und Linux
sichere Deutschkenntnisse, in Wort und Schrift (C1-Level)
Englischkenntnisse, in Wort und Schrift




Benefits




Ein junges, dynamisches, internationales Team, das offen für neue Ideen und Innovationen ist
Eine entspannte Arbeitsumgebung mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Ein familien- und kinderfreundliches Arbeitsumfeld
Ein attraktives Gehaltspaket mit Bonusmöglichkeiten
Ein umfangreiches Benefits-Paket inkl. Dienstrad und betrieblicher Altersvorsorge
Kontinuierliche Schulungen und Fortbildungen
Regelmäßige Firmen-Veranstaltungen und Team-Events




Worauf wartest du noch?




Du hast Leidenschaft für Informatik, Mathematik, Programmierung oder Online-Zocken und hast Lust in einem aufregenden Umfeld zu arbeiten, dann bewirb dich bei uns!




Wir freuen uns darauf, dich kennenzulernen.

Title: Software Engineer, Front-end (React)
text:
Work with the best




Orderly Network is a permissionless, decentralized exchange protocol and modular ecosystem built on top of NEAR. It uses an on-chain orderbook to provide a platform complete with a risk engine, matching engine, and shared asset pools for Dapps to build on top of. Dapps built on the Orderly Network will allow for financial instruments such as; Spot Trading, Margin Trading, Perpetual Swaps and Lending & Borrowing.




Whilst a fully independent team operates at Orderly Network, we were incubated by NEAR and WOO Network - Industry heavyweights in their respective fields. Thanks to both the guidance and expertise Orderly Network will offer market-leading execution with low latency and minimal fees with a combination of orderbook efficiency alongside on-chain settlement. We will become the go-to network for ecosystem partners to come and build upon.




A Glimpse into Your Future at Orderly Network
What will you be working on?
Develop web products that support digital asset trading.
Participate in building up innovative tools to enrich the ecosystem of our products.
Optimize the process of development, performance and user experience continuously.
Who will you be working with?
Maintain close collaboration with UI designer, product manager, and backend team to produce products of high quality.
What challenges will you face?
We're looking for a React Developer who has been involved in blockchain projects. This is a full-time remote position (possibility to work remotely as fully as partially). We are seeking a determined and creative developer who is passionate about changing the world through technology, someone who will join a team responsible for implementation of various solutions in the Blockchain and Dapp domains where reliability and efficiency of software is crucial.
Fast-paced working environment.
Learning ability and communication skills.
Self-management ability and a team working with people from different countries.
What tech stacks/skills will you be using?
React architecture - frequently
JavaScript, CSS, HTML, ES6, ESNext - frequently
Performance-optimizing - frequently




Interested in Learning More?




Our hiring process begins by meeting with our People Team, who help facilitate the process of placing you in your new role. You can expect to share your experience and ideas in online video interviews with our hiring team, made up of management and potential new colleagues.
If you have experience in developing trading systems or financial-related products is a plus.
You can prepare for this interview by mentally organizing your strategies and opinions on topics such as Web3, cryptocurrency trading platforms, and your vision of how to succeed.
Share this! Don't be afraid of friends or co-workers stealing this job! If you are amazing and smart we will find a place for you. Check out our External Referral Incentives Program as well.

Title: Data Center Engineer (Full-remote) - IT
Software Development Engineer II, Big Data
text:
Mapbox is the leading real-time location platform for a new generation of location-aware businesses. Mapbox is the only platform that equips organizations with the full set of tools to power the navigation of people, packages, and vehicles everywhere. More than 3.5 million registered developers have chosen Mapbox because of the platform’s flexibility, security and privacy compliance. Organizations use Mapbox applications, data, SDKs and APIs to create customized and immersive experiences that delight their customers. Whether you’re watching the delivery of your grocery order on Instacart, tracking your personal best mile on Strava, monitoring your gas budget on Metromile, or checking today’s forecast on The Weather Channel, Mapbox is the location and maps within those apps.




What We Are Working On




The Basemap team is responsible for the content and cartography of our Mapbox Streets visual map that is used by customers such as Toyota, Rivian, BMW, Y!Japan. The product you’ll be responsible for is seen by more than 700M monthly active users.




We're looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our team to create new maps for Automotive, Logistics, Consumer Applications, Outdoors and Gaming. Your team will work with the machine learning and data curation teams to create more detailed maps and process new data types such as points of interests, popular areas, outdoor and 3D features into maps.




Your technical skills and leadership will drive the feature development and operational excellence of these maps. You'll also bring your people management skills to ensure that the team is growing, while delivering on the roadmap. Our team uses a modern data processing stack using Python, Spark, Airflow to process datasets into map tiles using the Mapbox Tiling Service.




What You'll Do




Collaborate with the team to identify and scope out well-defined tasks
Execute on the scope and be accountable for delivering on time with quality
Design systems and make decisions that will keep pace with the rapid growth of Mapbox’s customer base.
Promote a culture of operational excellence by meticulously testing and monitoring our systems and code, writing documentation, and being on-call to support the health of our services.
Reduce technical debt, share your knowledge, and invest in your teammates’ health and happiness, while optimizing application performance and accelerating feature velocity.
Uphold a culture of collaboration, transparency, creativity, inclusion, and data-driven decisions.




What We Believe are Important Traits for This Role




3+ years of programming experience in building high-quality applications, data pipelines from ingestion to consumption within a big data architecture using Python
3+ years of experience with Big Data technologies such as Apache Spark, AWS - EMR, Airflow and Athena
In-depth understanding of data structures and algorithms
Ability to engage, learn and contribute quickly to the initiatives
Able to perform independently all the development tasks, based on designs and specs
High quality mindset -- write unit tests, proactively remedy defects and follow through to production
A desire to share your expertise through documentation, mentorship, pairing and both written and verbal discussion
A desire to work with individuals with diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences.




Nice-to-Haves




Experience in Terraform/Cloud Formation scripts to develop or support Infrastructure as Code
Proficiency in our stack — Node.js, AWS Services
An empirical analytical approach. You develop strong hypotheses, conduct spikes, and clearly communicate your findings.




What We Value




In addition to our core values, which are not unique to this position and are necessary for Mapbox leaders:




We value high-performing creative individuals who dig into problems and opportunities.
We believe in individuals being their whole selves at work. We commit to this through supportive health care, parental leave, flexibility for the things that come up in life, and innovating on how we think about supporting our people.
We emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.
We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.




By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you have received the Mapbox Non-US Privacy Notice for applicants, which is linked here. Completing this application requires you to provide personal data, such as your name and contact information, which is mandatory for Mapbox to process your application.




Mapbox is an EEO Employer - Minority/Female/Veteran/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

Title: Data Entry Analyst
text:
| Why C-MORE? |




C-MORE is a technology company, specializing in Software as a Service for sustainability management (ESG). We are committed to the idea that the success and future of companies depend on the successful integration of sustainability data, indicators, and initiatives (ESG) in their business models. To achieve this, we develop market-leading sustainability management software as plug-and-play SaaS for SMEs, financial institutions, and enterprises. We believe in fostering a culture of Collaboration to help our clients transition to this new approach, with each team member playing an integral part in our Mission-Driven ethos.




At C-MORE, we don’t want to only accept differences. We want to celebrate the difference and see beyond the obvious. C-More is proud to be an equal opportunity company, that does not discriminate against race, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, disability, or gender identity.




We Embrace a Culture of Collaboration, Mission-Driven, Openness, Responsibility, and Excellence




| Who and why are we hiring? |




C-MORE is looking for a meticulous, diligent, and detail-oriented individual to fill the position of a Data Entry Analyst. The ideal candidate should be proficient in data analysis, data management, and able to work accurately to meet deadlines. Knowledge of Excel functions, sustainable KPIs, and experience in the handling of business and sustainability reports is highly beneficial.




CORE TASKS ARE EXPECTED TO INCLUDE:




Perform data entry duties by gathering, compiling, and sorting information from various resources including sustainability reports, in alignment with our culture of Collaboration and Excellence.




Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets, demonstrating a Mission Driven approach to deliver meaningful results.




Verify accuracy and sort information according to priorities to prepare data for analysis, showing a strong sense of Responsibility.




Utilize Excel functions for data processing and analysis, maintaining an Openness to learn and apply new techniques.




Foster a collaborative environment by effectively communicating with team members and stakeholders.




REQUIREMENTS AND SKILLS:




Proven working experience in data entry or a related field.




Proficiency in using Microsoft Excel for data entry, data management, and calculations.




Attention to detail with an ability to spot numerical errors.




Good understanding of sustainability KPIs.




Ability to interpret and analyze complex data.




Excellent time management skills and the ability to meet deadlines.




Fluent English language.




Relevant education for the function.




Fast typing with an incredible eye for detail.




Creative and problem solver.




Resilient.




Autonomous and capable of multitasking, planning, and prioritizing.




Strong alignment with our C-MORE culture and values.




APPLICATION TEST:




In order to proceed with the application, we invite you to complete the next step of the process.




This next step consists of a data entry test.




The goal of this test is: to complete the requested information for some companies, according to several Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that you will find in each sustainability report of the correspondent company.




Before you start this process, please, take the time to read the instructions on this e-mail, carefully, so you don’t miss any cues that might help you with the test.




First step: Please open the link below and download all the files. If there's no link showing (some platforms erase active content), copy and paste the URL in the mandatory question tab.




Second step: Analyze the folder in which you will find an Excel workbook with 2 tabs:




An index, which will contain the description of the Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) you will be required to fill out. You will also find other information that will be useful during your test, such as expected measures of the KPIs (e.g., Millions $), sections of the reports in which you might find the requested info, and keywords to help you in your search.




An Excel spreadsheet that you should complete with the requested information:




In line 3, you will find an example of a company that already has the requested information, in the way that it should be reported.




In lines 5, 6, and 7 you can find the 3 listed companies for which you need to find and insert data.




The columns present the KPIs and respective units in which the information should be entered.




Third step: Verify that you have a total of 4 reports, one for each company listed on the Excel file.




Fourth Step: We suggest you read the index first, and then try to find the already completed information of the company in line 2. If you are able to find all the available information of this company, please proceed to the next step.




Fifth step: Complete the missing information of the companies in lines 5, 6 and 7.




Some important guidelines and instructions to complete this task that you should keep in mind:




Only one value should be reported in each cell (no intervals).




Do not use text to report, unless in KPIs that require it (e.g., Country of the company).




Only use a comma separator for decimal values (you should not use separators for hundreds, millions, etc.).




All values must be reported with 2 decimal cases (if applicable).




No symbols should be used, i.e. if the value to report is 8,94%, only insert 8,94.




If you can’t find information for one of the KPIs, please leave the cell blank.




In some cases, you may need to convert values to the requested units. In these cases, refer to the previous index for clarification on which measure to use and convert accordingly (e.g., Thousands $ to Millions $).




You may need to use excel formulas to calculate some KPIs. In these cases, refer to the previous index for clarification on which calculations you might need to conduct.




We remind you that the goal of this test is to find the right requested KPI information on the reports provided and enter it in the data entry file, for each company.




Please reply to this application attaching the completed Excel file that you received with the following file name format: Data Entry_test_[YOUR NAME]




You’ll receive prompt feedback after we carry out our internal analysis.




At C-MORE, we recognize that our strength and success lie in the collective abilities and diversity of our team. We are committed to creating an environment where everyone can bring their full selves to work, grow professionally, and make a meaningful impact. If you believe you can contribute to our mission and embody our values, we encourage you to apply.




We thank all applicants for their interest in C-MORE, however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.




Come join us and let’s build a great company culture together!

Title: Software Engineer IC3.1 - Freelance [Remote]
text:
ABOUT US:

Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.

JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)
LOCATION: Remote - Dublin, Ireland only (TimeZone: GMT/WET | Full day overlap)
HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $55 – $63/hr
ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term
BRAINTRUST JOB ID: 7172


THE OPPORTUNITY

Our Client is looking for a candidate located in Dublin for this role.

Job Description

About The Team

The Payments Regulation, Money Movement squad is responsible for the movement of money from an Etsy buyer to seller. They are working with payment regulations and evolving how money is routed in the most efficient, compliant and cost saving way, globally.

About The Role

In this role, you will touch all parts of the Etsy web stack, which is primarily PHP with some data analysis using MySQL. You'll need to think hard about the Etsy payments eco system, payments processors, database sharding, replication, performance, stability, metrics, integration resiliency and more! You will learn and iterate in a world full of high impact changes to the Etsy payments platform on a global scale.

What you’ll be working on

Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science
2 or more years of PHP experience, preferably in an agile environment
Ability to write basic SQL queries for fetching and analysing transactional data
Comfort using Agile methods, like picking up stories/tasks from a project (Jira) board
Passionate about delivering clean, readable and tested code
Ability to juggle the responsibilites of pushing code with monitoring and dashboard inspecting


Details/Notes

This request will support the team while an admin is away on leave and is unlikely to extend.
This role is eligible for a hybrid work mode (partially in office and partially remote). Candidates should be located in Ireland and available to work standard hours (either 10a-6p or 9a-5p).
Interview process details will be provided here once available.


Apply Now!

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Title: Software Engineer
text:
About Alectris:

Alectris is a leading organization in the renewable energy industry that delivers asset care innovation. With its integrated suite of operations, maintenance and asset management services, award-winning software ACTIS, and retrofit technologies, it empowers owners with full control of their portfolios to realize worry-free, high performing solar assets. More on www.alectris.com.




Responsibilities are:

Member of ACTIS solar ERP development team
Cooperation and coordination with the rest of Software Engineers and Project Manager to meet customers’ requirements.
Analyzing clients’ requirements and preparation of detailed specification documents
Assistance to Business Development Managers for quote preparation.




Qualifications:

Minimum 2 years’ experience in software engineering using C#, .Net, JavaScript, Html, CSS
Experience in developing Windows Services, Web Api and WCF web services using C#, .Net.
Good knowledge of relational DBs, knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server (querying, indexing, performance tuning, maintain)
Experience in administrating IIS web server and deployed web sites (application pools, certificates, bindings etc.)
Capable of undertaking all stages of a project. From analysis and cost estimation to development, deployment, debugging, monitoring and optimizing.
Very good knowledge of English at written and spoken level
Able to work as a member of a team and alone. Willing to learn and to train others.




Candidates profile:

Experience using Logi Info will be a big plus.
Experience in Microsoft Platform will be a big plus.
Experience in implementing integrations between multiple systems using API’s, CSV files and FTP or SQL Databases will be a big plus.
Experience in customizing and extending Microsoft Dynamics CRM (C# CRM SDK, Plugins, JavaScript) will be a big plus.
University Degree in Computer Science / Software Engineering
Experience in Microsoft SharePoint Online would be good.

Title: Software Engineer (Backend) (f/m/d) - Mobile Wallet and Automation SaaS
text:
At Miss Moneypenny Technologies we’re passionate about connection. It’s in our DNA. Miss Moneypenny Tech has been recognized to solve some industries dire need to be able to connect to users at all – for the German Insurance Market we are recently turning into a ‘must have’.




As demand is accelerating, we are looking to strengthen our Miss Moneypenny Technologies team! Do you have a passion for smart technology and are you interested in exciting, challenging lighthouse cooperations with renowned partners?




We are looking for your spirit, your desire for startup-culture and -adventure and invite you to meet the overwhelming demand of our solution on the market hands-on with us. Or in short: Go on super productive roller coaster ride with our founders and our team!




We are a startup with head office in Berlin and tech hub in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. We rely on qualitative growth from our own resources and with the support of renowned VCs.




By using wallet technology at key touchpoints, we enable leading companies to create more valuable relationships with their customers and create a real alternative to traditional apps and web portals. We are heralding a new age for digital interfaces between users and companies - that is exciting and drives us every day.




Tasks




We want you to...




Write great software in an autonomous, full-stack scrum team in constant exchange with your teammates
Share your knowledge and empower your teammates on a personal level as well as engineering wide
Be curious and open to new ideas as well as embrace your core interests, especially and not limited to Golang & PostgreSQL
Challenge what we do and how we do it so that it is easy for you to answer "Why am I doing this?"
Embrace our values




Requirements




You...




feel good talking, chatting and writing in English
like giving and taking feedback
are or want to become a fully-fledged Golang backend engineer
own things you started and you have a high sense of responsibility
consider writing software a team effort and can commit to openness, respect and high demand of broad communication
can imagine working in Germany or Vietnam someday
consider manual testing and test automation a part of your craftsmanship
take extra care regarding quality, analytics, security and operability
can show and explain the user benefit of your and your team's increments




Benefits




We highly value open communication, trust and having a great time.
We are family-friendly, inclusive and colorful.
We are fair and appreciate you
You will engage in outstanding innovation projects with renowned and exciting clients.
You will find us connecting business and technology when and wherever possible. You are not going to find insular thinking or be in an outsourced tech department.
Your professional development will benefit from fast pace, constant learning and start up dynamics.
You can dream big together with us!




These are our values:




Strive for personal growth
Be humble, be confident, be awesome
Enable each other with trust and an open mind
Elaborate innovative and simple solutions
Take ownership, think ahead, stay alert
We have grit!




We look forward to receiving your application with your CV, salary expectations and the earliest possible start! Please do not invest your time in a long, formal cover letter. We would like a short and honest classification in key points why you are the match for the advertised role and why you will enjoy it.

Title: Data Analyst
text:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.

 

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Ideal Candidate




Fluent in English
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Portugal.
Analytical mindset. 

Job Requirements

 

Must be living in Portugal for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.  

Technical requirements to perform the work

 

Access to a laptop or computer which uses:

-       A logon account unique to you

-       Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed

-    Only one member per household may apply

  NB. All products should be provided at your own expense.

 

Benefits

 

· Work up to 20 hours per week.

· Earn a competitive rate of pay.

· Develop your research skills.

· Avoid the long commute.

· Work from the comfort of your home office.

· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!
