Title: Software Test Engineer
text:
Job Title:         Software Test Engineer

Role:          Full-time, Permanent, Remote

Salary:             €35K - €40K




Company Introduction

PrivacyEngine is Ireland's leading providers of a range of services aimed at supporting organisations who wish to achieve and maintain a level of compliance with European Data Protection legislation.




Our product, PrivacyEngine, manages all aspects of data protection programs, including privacy compliance, staff management and vendor management to address local and global privacy challenges at scale and demonstrate compliance that fits your industry, sector or company use case.




Job Description

We are seeking a talented and motivated Software Test Engineer to join our dynamic software development team.




The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our software products through effective manual testing practices. The Software Tester will work closely with developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to identify, report, and address defects, while also contributing to the continuous improvement of our testing processes.




If you’d like to join a David, and not a Goliath, then we’d love to hear from you!




Key Responsibilities




Develop and execute comprehensive test plans and test cases for both manual and automated testing, ensuring coverage of all relevant use cases and scenarios.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand software requirements, design specifications, and user stories in order to create effective test strategies.
Write, maintain, and execute manual test scripts to identify defects, performance issues, and usability problems.
Perform regression testing to verify the stability of existing features after code changes and updates.
Conduct exploratory testing to uncover potential issues that might not be covered by existing test cases.
Collaborate with developers to reproduce, document, and prioritize reported defects and issues.
Participate in the software release process by validating and signing off on product releases based on testing results.
Actively contribute to the improvement of testing processes, tools, and methodologies to enhance the overall quality and efficiency of testing efforts.
Stay up-to-date with industry best practices, emerging trends, and new technologies in software testing and quality assurance.




Requirements




Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Graduated from course in the last 4 years
2+ years’ experience as a Software Tester or Quality Assurance Engineer, with a strong background in both manual testing.
Proficiency in designing and executing manual test cases, as well as creating and maintaining detailed test documentation.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to troubleshoot and isolate issues effectively.
Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members, developers, and other stakeholders.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks while meeting deadlines.
A proactive attitude towards learning and adapting to new technologies and tools.
Experience with Selenium (C# Web Driver) is desirable but not essential
Experience with C# in the context of test automation programming is desirable but not essential

Title: DevOps Engineer - Logging
text:
LivePerson (NASDAQ:LPSN) is a Conversational AI company creating digital experiences that are Curiously Human. Every person is unique, and our technology makes it possible for companies, including leading brands like HSBC, Orange, and GM Financial, to treat their audiences that way at scale. Nearly a billion conversational interactions are powered by our Conversational Cloud each month.




You'll be successful at LivePerson if you are excited to build something from the ground up. You excel by finding daily opportunities to grow at the same pace as the technology we're building, and you build partnerships that improve our business. Likewise, you're someone who sees feedback as a chance to learn and grow and believes decisions powered by data are the norm. You care about the well-being of others and yourself.




Overview




We are seeking DevOps Observability Engineer, member of the Logging Infrastructure Engineering team, you will be responsible for, developing, deploying and managing the Observability solution that provides actionable insights into our application infrastructure.




You Will




Understand the design and architecture of new highly-available and fault-tolerant cloud-based logging infrastructure, as well as how we redesign existing systems
Participate and collaborate with the team taking ownership of the fast growing logging infrastructure and deliver bar-raising solutions
Investigate hard-to-pin-down problems across a complex and distributed architecture so you can explain root causes and propose solutions
Advocate for solutions that help teams launch quality software without compromising delivery speed
Participates in the team’s on-call rotation in accordance to LivePerson’s on-call requirements
Assist internal teams with issues and training around leveraging LivePerson’s IaC and Configuration Management technologies, such as Terraform and Ansible.
Implement and maintain LivePerson’s Kubernetes Logging platform.




You Have




2+ years of experience in a DevOps or Software Engineering role.
Experience with building successful production software systems using (ELK stack: Filebeat, Logstash, Elasticsearch), Dashboards, and Alerts
Experience with working with PubSub, Cloud Routers, GKE (Kubernetes/Helm) on GCP
Experience with working with Terraform TFE
Exposure to Fluentd, Puppet and Linux preferred
Good to have some experience or willingness to learn Python, Makefile, Github/Gitlab
Familiarity creating architectures that scale with volume and are fault-tolerant
Familiarity with distributed systems & asynchronous messaging
Proven ability to work in a fully remote environment with people across the globe
Relevant certifications are a plus (e.g AWS Certification, Google Cloud Platform Certification)
Excellent English level.




Benefits




Health: medical, dental, and vision
Time away: 28 vacation days
Development: Native AI learning
Additional: Food Vouchers, monthly phone and internet allowance.




Why You'll Love Working Here




Your entrepreneurial spirit will be supported. We love team members who chase down their big ideas, become experts, help colleagues, and own their work. These four company values guide our continued, holistic growth as individuals, as teams, and as a global organization. And to further make our point, let's just say we're very proud to be on Fast Company's list of Most Innovative Companies and Newsweek's list of most-loved workplaces. At LivePerson, the option to work remotely has helped shape who we are today: a collective of innovators and industry leaders working toward the same vision without ego. While we maintain hubs in NY and Seattle as well as WeWork locations across the globe, our employees choose the environments that work best for them from anywhere around the globe.




Belonging at LivePerson




At LivePerson, people from diverse backgrounds come together to make an impact and be their authentic selves. One way we share and connect is through our employee resource groups such as: Live In Color, LP Proud, and Women In Tech. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.




We are committed to the accessibility needs of applicants and employees. We provide reasonable accommodations to job applicants with physical or mental disabilities. Applicants with a disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should inform their recruiting contact upon initial connection.

Title: Data Engineer / Scientist - Environnement - Full télétravail
text:
MP DATA est une société spécialisée dans l’acquisition, le traitement, et la valorisation des données.




Depuis sa création en 2015, MP DATA accompagne ses clients, majoritairement industriels, dans le management de leur performance, l’exploitation de leur données et leur décarbonation par des cas d'usage Data Science.




Les collaborateurs, tous issus de grandes écoles, incarnent au quotidien les valeurs d’Excellence, de Partage et d’Engagement.




Ils associent savoir-faire technique, méthodologie et passion et mettent leurs compétences au service de missions et projets au sein de grands groupes français.




MP DATA accompagne ses clients sur toute la chaine au travers de 3 pôles d’expertise : Conseil et Stratégie, Infrastructure & CloudOPS, Data Science.




Chez MP DATA, les équipes commerciales cherchent des missions en fonction des envies des collaborateurs et non pas l’inverse. Les consultants sont accompagnés dans tous leurs projets, de la mobilité géographique, au changement de secteur d’activité en passant par le développement de nouvelles compétences. Rejoindre MP DATA, c’est la garantie de travailler sur des sujets passionnants avec un cadre technique fort, et des possibilités d'évolution intéressantes.




Vos missions




MP DATA, recrute un(e) Data Scientist avec des affinités pour le métier de Data Engineer (H/F) afin de travailler pour un client, acteur majeur du secteur de la santé à Paris. Vous serez amené à intervenir sur plusieurs problématiques notamment : travail des données, développement d'algorithmes de machine learning, déploiement de ces algorithmes. Tout cela autour de cas d'usages industriels à forte valeur ajoutée et impact environnemental positif.




Accompagné par un Lead Data Scientist et un Lead Data Engineer, vous monterez en compétences sur : le management des flux de données (pré processing, feature engineering...) ainsi que la mise en place et l'industrialisation de ces modèles de machine learning. Les seniors vous guideront step by step dans l'utilisation de ces nouvelles technologies.




Vos compétences




Ingénieur d'une Grande École, vous avez des connaissances en machine learning acquises lors de votre scolarité ou de vos expériences passées (stage ou césure). Votre autonomie, votre capacité à être force de proposition et votre esprit de synthèse ont été reconnues durant vos précédentes expériences (stage ou césure).




Vous êtes intéressés pour vous dépasser en data science & data engineering et vous avez des premières expériences dans ce domaine, comme par exemple :




C/C++ / Java / Rust
Spark
Kafka
Cloud : AWS / GCP / Azure
Technologies de stockage : Snowflake / S3 / GCS / Azure Blob
Django / Flask
Git
SQL : Postgres / MongoDB
CI/CD.





Alors venez grandir avec nous !

Title: Data Vault Engineer
text:
We are on a mission! Keyrus is a key player in consulting and technology specialised in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning and Digital Transformation with clients in more than 25 countries in 4 continents.

We are seeking a Data Vault Engineer in a fully remote working setting.

Job Summary

This position will work across multiple disciplines to satisfy key client initiatives by delivering data vault solutions that scale efficiently while improving performance and minimizing costs. The Data Engineer works independently, with minimal supervision and is the lead for their technical domain or discipline. This role provides Data Vault technical leadership to the engineering team, is able to work across multiple disciplines, and is looked to by others for guidance.

The Data Engineer is a lead contributor in leading Data Vault strategies, standards, new capabilities, and design to enable faster and easier data access, automated workflows, and technical proofs of concept. The Data Engineer will have experience in design, implementation and support of data integration and ETL/ELT solutions. The position will require experience and working knowledge of Data Vault along with agile and/or Lean methodologies to deliver information services in an efficient and repeatable manner.

The Data Engineer proactively works with customers, stakeholders, analysts, architects, and other engineers to troubleshoot and find root cause of solution defects. They need to be excellent team players and have demonstrated experience across multiple systems.

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent STEM field
+3 years of experience in delivery of data engineering solutions on large, heterogeneous datasets, to include data modeling, database/data mart development, ETL/ELT/data integration, and data security
Data Vault 2.0 & Dimensional modeling/ Star Schema
Certified Data Vault 2.0 Practitioner (CDVP2) is nice to have
Ability to work in Data integration technologies such as data replication/CDC, message-oriented data movement, API, data stream integration, or CEP
Knowledge of data governance framework (DMBOK, TDWI, etc.)
Strong soft skills, verbal and written communication
Fluent English

What We Offer At Keyrus Portugal

Salary based on your skills and experience and according to the Data market practices.
Food ticket of €8.32 per day
Private Medical Insurance
22 days of paid vacation
Training Program through KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience)

Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

You will be part of a young and ever learning enterprise with an established international network of thought leading professionals driven by bridging the gap between innovation and business. You get the opportunity to meet specialised and professional consultants in a multicultural ecosystem.

Keyrus gives you the opportunity to showcase your talents and potential, to build up experience through working with our clients, with the opportunity to grow depending on your capabilities and affinities, in a great working and dynamic atmosphere.

At Keyrus Portugal, we're more than just a company - we're a constellation of bright minds and innovative souls.

If you're seeking a place where your passion meets purpose, where every project is a canvas and every challenge an opportunity, then look no further.

Join us, and be a part of a community that's shaping the digital frontier. At Keyrus Portugal, your journey to greatness begins.

Title: Data Analyst
text:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.

 

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Ideal Candidate




Fluent in English
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Ireland.
Analytical mindset. 

Job Requirements

 

Must be living in Ireland for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.  

Technical requirements to perform the work

 

Access to a laptop or computer which uses:

-       A logon account unique to you

-       Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed

Title: Software Engineer - Graphics - Direct Hire [Remote]
text:
ABOUT US:

Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.

JOB TYPE: Direct Hire/ FTE Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)
LOCATION: Remote - Europe
SALARY RANGE: $25,000 – $40,000/yr
ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term
BRAINTRUST JOB ID: 6978


THE OPPORTUNITY

About Us

Collaborative 3D building design tool (Think Figma for building designs).

More than 4k users globally with renowned firms like WeWork, Square Yards, etc implementing projects on Snaptrude. Backed by Accel Partners, Foundamental, Tiferes VC among other notable investors.

Qualifications

1+ years of graphics development work experience, preferably with exposure to WebGL, threejs, GLSL shaders etc
Very strong fundamentals in Javascript programming & computer graphics
An added benefit if familiar with ExpressJS and/or Django frameworks
Strong fundamentals in Algorithms & Data Structures
You learn quickly, regardless of the languages and technologies used
You have experience taking ownership and shipping entire features end-to-end
A strong focus on user experience. You're someone who's passionate about building beautiful, modern UX that people love.
What you’ll be working on

Build modular, reusable components and features for our graphics engine
Own & implement modules in the product with a huge amount of autonomy
Find and address graphics & rendering issues
Collaborate with a small and nimble team of engineers


Apply Now!

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Title: Software Engineer with IBM Rational Tools
text:
As a dynamic multinational tech company operating in 50 countries, we drive innovation and create projects that shape the future and greatly enhance the quality of life. You will find our solutions in the space industry, supporting scientists in the development of cancer drugs, and implementing innovative technological solutions for industrial clients worldwide. These are just some of the areas in which we operate!




 

Currently, for the new Seargin project we are looking for a Software Engineer.




Responsibilities:

• Work with IBM Rational Tools on bank’s core Finance Accounting system mainly based on Mainframe: DB2®, PL/I, CICS®, and Tivoli Workload Scheduler

• Design and develop new code features to existing solution.

• Have an opportunity to work with REST APIs and event-based integrations.

• Maintain and improve existing Mainframe solutions.

• Work in an agile & collaborative manner within internationally (Denmark, India, and Lithuania) distributed squad

• Working closely with other developers to ensure development is in par with development guidelines and best practices.

 

Requirements:

• IBM mainframe knowledge (z/OS), TWS (OPC) – jobs, dependencies, APPL, use of OPC variables

• PL/I (could be substituted with Cobol)

• JCL – programming, DB2 unload, Sort

• DB2 and SQL

• Good understanding of development lifecycle process Willingness to learn new programming languages, tools and processes.

• Have a high level of personal responsibility and commitment to the team goals.

• Analytical mindset to understand the problem and turn it into solution using code as a tool.

• Good communication skills in English – both written and verbal

Title: Fullstack Software Engineer - Cloud / DevOps / Git / Home Office (m/w/d)
text:

Title: Data Analyst
text:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.

 

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Ideal Candidate




Fluent in English
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Italy.
Analytical mindset. 

Job Requirements

 

Must be living in Italy for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.  

Technical requirements to perform the work

 

Access to a laptop or computer which uses:

-       A logon account unique to you

-       Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed

-    Only one member per household may apply

  NB. All products should be provided at your own expense.

 

Benefits

 

· Work up to 20 hours per week.

· Earn a competitive rate of pay.

· Develop your research skills.

· Avoid the long commute.

· Work from the comfort of your home office.

· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!

 

Apply Online Today!

  

This is a freelance, independent contractor position.

Title: Software Engineer, Telemetry
text:
Our mission is to secure and manage Ubuntu on IoT devices globally. With billions of connected devices running Linux, we think the opportunity for Ubuntu is enormous, and we will need a high-performance, scalable management system to ensure they are healthy, up to date, and doing what they should be doing! Our device management and telemetry team is building a cloud-native solution for large-scale estate and fleet management, ultimately aiming to be the industry standard for devices of every category.




This is an opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and web services at scale.




Canonical's engineering team are at the forefront of the IoT revolution. Ubuntu is the number one Linux for IoT, and with Ubuntu Core we have set the pace for device security. We are now working to expand our portfolio with industry-leading, secure, auditable and reliable telemetry services.




The right candidate will be part of the team that will provide the backbone to our expanding IoT market, enhancing both our on-prem offering as well as scaling to a global cloud-based platform.




What you'll do




Collaborate with a globally distributed team.
Write scalable service APIs in Python and Golang to provide telemetry services.
Develop observability, remote logging, data acquisition, alert and notification, and edge processing capabilities
Work with our infrastructure team to develop both a cloud-based SaaS offering as well as a containerised local on-prem solution.
Design and implement new features and enhancements from spec to production at scale.
Review code and technical designs produced by other engineers.
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions.
Work remotely with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events.




Who you are




You love technology and working with a diverse set of talented people.
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable.
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated.
You have a broad technology base but favor backend code and infrastructure.
You have a good understanding of cybersecurity and the challenges of the IoT environment.
You have knowledge and experience of telemetry systems including data streaming technologies, observability and monitoring systems, and the application of security/IAM models to such systems.
You have proficiency in developing tooling and libraries, and the design and implementation of back-end web services, messaging/data pipelines, and REST APIs using python and/or Golang
You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform.
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree.




About Canonical




Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 1000+ professionals across 70+ countries. We want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace.




What Canonical offers:




Work from home
Learning and development allowances
Competitive Salary
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Generous annual leave
Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave
Priority Pass for travel
Exposure to international business and technology




We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Cloud data Engineer Streaming - Télétravail
text:
Bonjour !




MP DATA est une société spécialisée dans l’acquisition, le traitement, et la valorisation des données. Depuis sa création en 2015, MP DATA accompagne ses clients, majoritairement industriels, dans le management de leur performance, l’exploitation de leur données et leur décarbonation.




Les collaborateurs, incarnent au quotidien les valeurs d’Excellence, de Partage et d’Engagement. Ils associent savoir-faire technique, méthodologie et passion et mettent leurs compétences au service de missions et projets au sein de grands groupes français.




MP DATA accompagne ses clients sur toute la chaine de la donnée au travers de 3 pôles d’expertise : Conseil et Stratégie, Infrastructure & CloudOPS, Data Science.




Chez MP DATA, les équipes commerciales cherchent des missions en fonction des envies des collaborateurs et non pas l’inverse. Les consultants sont accompagnés dans tous leurs projets, de la mobilité géographique, au changement de secteur d’activité en passant par le développement de nouvelles compétences. Rejoindre MP DATA, c’est la garantie de travailler sur des sujets passionnants avec un cadre technique fort, et des possibilités d'évolution intéressantes.




Vos missions




MP DATA, recrute un Data Engineer expert de la stack technique AWS afin de travailler sur un projet impactant de création de datalake pour un client, acteur majeur du secteur transport, le tout en télétravail.




Vos missions seront les suivantes :




Proposer des architectures et orienter le choix des technologies adaptées aux besoins de différents projets Data
Concevoir et mettre en œuvre les traitements d’alimentation du DataLake et de transformation des données
Création de pipelines de données, traitement et transformation de la donnée.
Garantir la qualité des données en mettant en place les outils de mesure et de suivi adéquats
Identifier, collecter, explorer, comprendre et intégrer les données nécessaires à la résolution de problématiques métier et opérationnelles
Assurer le suivi de la production





Vos compétences




De formation Bac+5 (ou plus) en développement informatique / data engineering, vous justifiez de plusieurs expériences professionnelles au cours desquelles vous avez pu développer les compétences techniques suivantes :




Ingénierie des données en temps réel :




MQTT : Expérience dans la configuration et la gestion de flux MQTT pour la lecture de données en streaming provenant de différents appareils connectés.
Kafka : Maîtrise des concepts de la plateforme Kafka, tels que les producteurs, les consommateurs et les topics, pour le traitement de flux de données en temps réel à grande échelle.
(Idéalement) Flink : Expertise dans l'utilisation de Flink pour la mise en œuvre de pipelines de traitement de données en streaming, en appliquant des transformations complexes et en gérant les états.
Langages de programmation (Python, SQL) : (Idéalement Java ou Scala) Compétence avancée dans l'écriture de code efficace et maintenable pour la manipulation et l'analyse de données en temps réel.





Calcul distribué :




Apache Spark, Spark Streaming : Expérience dans l'utilisation de Spark pour le traitement distribué de gros volumes de données en temps réel.
Hadoop : Connaissance de bases de l’écosystème Hadoop (HDFS, Zookeper, Yarn,, Hive, Hbase …) pour le stockage et la gestion de données à grande échelle, permettant un accès rapide et parallèle aux fichiers.





Conteneurisation et orchestration :




Docker : Maîtrise de Docker pour la création d'images conteneurisées et l'orchestration des services nécessaires au traitement de données en temps réel.
Kubernetes : Capacité à déployer et à gérer des applications conteneurisées à grande échelle à l'aide de Kubernetes, en assurant la résilience et l'évolutivité des services.





Cloud AWS :




Amazon S3 : Connaissance approfondie du stockage objet S3 pour l'archivage et le traitement des données en temps réel à grande échelle.
AWS Lambda : Expérience dans la création de fonctions Lambda pour l'exécution de traitements basés sur des événements en temps réel, offrant une scalabilité automatique.
Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) : Capacité à déployer et à gérer des clusters Kubernetes hautement disponibles et élastiques sur EKS pour le traitement de données en temps réel.
Elastic Container Service (ECS) : Expertise dans l'utilisation d'ECS pour exécuter et gérer des conteneurs dans un environnement hautement évolutif et tolérant aux pannes.
Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) : Maîtrise de la configuration et du dimensionnement d'instances EC2 pour répondre aux besoins de calcul des pipelines de données en temps réel.





Bonnes pratiques et principes de conception du cloud :




Connaissance approfondie des meilleures pratiques pour l'utilisation efficace du cloud, y compris la gestion des coûts, la sécurité des données et la disponibilité des services.





CI/CD, développement logiciel et gestion de projets :




Expérience pratique dans la gestion de projets liés au traitement de données en temps réel.
Connaissance des principes du CI/CD (intégration continue et déploiement continu) pour assurer un flux de développement fluide et une livraison efficace des fonctionnalités.





Alors venez grandir avec nous !

Title: Big Data Applications DevOps Engineer
text:
Job Description

DXC Technology (NYSE: DXC) is the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public sector clients across 70 countries. The company’s technology independence, global talent and extensive partner alliance combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. DXC Technology is recognized among the best corporate citizens globally. For more information, visit www.dxc.technology.

DXC in Poland is located in Warsaw and Wroclaw.

Application Services Global Delivery Poland located in Warsaw, offers software development and maintenance services to DXC Technology customers all over the world. Poland Center focuses on Data Warehousing/Business Intelligence, Web Solutions, SAP R/3 and SAP BW implementation, Application Management, Quality Assurance & Testing, Business and Systems Analysis. Most of GDAS Poland Center employees hold multiple certifications from Oracle, Sun, Microsoft, SAP, OBI, ISEB, ISTQB, ITIL, CMMI, PMP and Six Sigma.

We Are Currently Looking For

Big Data Applications DevOps Engineer

Job location: Warsaw or remote

The successful candidate will work within Analytics practice and be mainly responsible for operations and DevOps support for new solutions and/or enhancements to business applications. The work will be delivered for a strategic multinational customer from autonomous driving area.

The scope of responsibilities will cover delivery of operations support, concept creation and transition to operations following DevOps model. The work packages will be defined in direct agreement with business users on customer’s side. Responsibilities will include last level support for incident and problem resolution, implementation of fixes, development and release of approved changes based on customer requirements and needs.

We Require

University degree (B.Sc. or M.Sc.),
At least two years of working experience as IT support team member, DevOps Specialist
Working experience in one of the following programming languages: Python
Knowledge of Operating System – Unix/Linux
Fluent written and spoken English
Solid problem solving and analytical skills
Strong interpersonal skills
Autonomous, strong ownership and drive to get things done
Eagerness to learn and adaptability to changes
Professional and responsible approach to work with customer focus

We Appreciate

Knowledge of Ansible, Airflow, Openshift
Knowledge and experience with any of following solutions: MapR, Hadoop, GIT, Jenkins, Grafana, Nagios, Prometheus
ITIL methodology familiarity
Experience with Agile methodologies: Scrum/Kanban
Experience in working in multinational environment

We Offer

We offer a steady job in an international company in the heavily invested area, where you will encounter multiple opportunities to cooperate with inspiring people from across the world. A place where you can learn, work with experts, share your knowledge and enjoy many social activities and events prepared for our Employees.

Additionally, We Offer

Full-time employment contract
Numerous opportunities for personal and professional development and advancement within the company by taking part in interesting and challenging projects
Modern and friendly work environment with open door policy
Flexibility in work arrangement (home-office culture & flexible working hours are in our DNA)
Professional technical and soft skill training programs (internal DXC University, DXC Partners Network and certification program), opportunity to learn and evolve within a team of experienced colleagues
Private medical care, social benefits system, life insurance, Multisport+ card, Wellness Program (massages included), German language classes, relax corner (XBOX games and other), sport communities
Employee Assistance Program (providing help for employees in difficult life situations)
Competitive compensation package adjusted to candidate’s experience and qualifications
Not only convenient but also picturesque location – our Warsaw office is located at the lake, near metro and tram station

Title: Senior Software Engineer - ML (f/m/d)
text:
Factory software is at the core of value creation, it is crucial to our society because it helps manufacturing companies become more productive, efficient, and environmentally friendly at producing all we need for our daily lives. Due to the complex and heterogeneous nature of factories, building factory software is exceedingly difficult. HappyOps is solving this problem. We strive to build and run powerful data-driven applications that help factories answer questions, reduce waste, and increase performance. In order to do that we build software modules using a variety of cutting edge technologies. Our applications run in multiple factories across Europe and across different industries.




Tasks




We are looking for an experienced software engineer with an academic background and/or professional experience in data science / AI to join our team. You will be responsible for creating value out of data sets we capture from our customer’s factories by harnessing the power of AI.




You will add your own talents and experience to the team: together we will push the envelope and move the boundary of what is considered possible in the space of advanced software systems on the factory shop-floor.




Your responsibilities:




Set up a tech stack / architecture to run ML workloads
Conceptualize and develop first AI use case hypotheses in close collaboration with our customers / domain experts
Validate these hypotheses by implementing, testing and running applications in production
Conduct research on whether GenAI and LLMs can be used to create value in manufacturing processes




Requirements




We seek an outstanding candidate, who is highly driven, smart, confident, and gritty. Our perfect match is hungry to learn and enjoys working in fast-paced environments.




You have at least 5+ years of experience working in software development, ideally on full-stack applications, but in the last few years you have been gaining experience in the field of AI and ML
You have experience building and deploying scalable machine learning solutions and data-driven systems
You are familiar with Typescript, Node.js and PosGresSQL
You are a pragmatic engineer. You love challenges and you have a roll-up-your-sleeves and get-stuff-done attitude
You have a strong curiosity and forward-thinking mindset in the field of AI, with an interest in exploring AI technologies into product development.
You have excellent analytical skills, you are diligent, have great attention to detail, and you are able to consistently deliver results under pressure
You value close collaboration with the founder, to shape the product together
You are fluent in English, German is a plus




Benefits




A unique opportunity to revolutionize the manufacturing industry, displace old-school software, and have a tangible impact on the HappyOps success story




A highly relevant technical challenge paired with stimulating use cases from the tangible real world
A world-class multicultural team: we don’t just work together, we truly care about each other and seek to bring out the best in each other every day
If you need more private time to take care of your loved ones then we will try our best to accommodate their needs
A flexible and high-paced work environment, with low hierarchies, competitive compensation, and equity package
We are a remote-first team, so you will have the chance to work from anywhere in Germany, with flexible working hours.




Compensation Range: the compensation range for this role as a base salary is 80,000€ - 110,000€ annually.




Does this sound like you? Then we would love to hear from you! We encourage everyone to apply! In case this role sounds interesting but you don’t think you meet all the qualifications, we will still be happy to hear from you! We are interested to hear about the value you can bring to the role and to HappyOps.




Last but not least, when judging your fit for this position we will not consider your age, gender, sexual identity and/or expression, ethnicity, or religion as these are not relevant to your role within the team.

Title: Fullstack Software Engineer - Cloud / DevOps / Git / Home Office (m/w/d)
text:
Als Fullstack Software Engineer (m/w/d) bist du ein wesentlicher Baustein unseres technologischen Fortschritts. Du formst und implementierst wegweisende Softwarelösungen, die sowohl die Geschäftsprozesse unserer Kunden als auch unsere internen Abläufe revolutionieren.




Dein breit gefächertes Aufgabenspektrum erstreckt sich von der Beratung unserer Kund:innen, über das Entwickeln maßgeschneiderter Softwarelösungen zur Bewältigung komplexer Anforderungen, bis hin zur aktiven Mitgestaltung unserer Produktentwicklung. In jeder Rolle nutzt du deine Expertise und Kreativität, um die Herausforderungen von heute in die Lösungen von morgen zu verwandeln.




Was erwartet dich?




Du berätst unsere Kunden und entwickelst maßgeschneiderte Softwarelösungen
Du gestaltest aktiv unsere Produktentwicklung mit
Du setzt deine Expertise und Kreativität ein, um heutige Herausforderungen in morgige Lösungen zu verwandeln




Was solltest du mitbringen?




Du sprichst fließend Deutsch
Du bist erfahren in sowohl Front-End- als auch Back-End-Entwicklung
Du hast einen besonderen Fokus auf Angular, Cloud Computing (Azure, AWS), C# oder Java, Datenbanken und Service-Architekturen
Du bist offen für Neues, ein Teamplayer und hast Interesse daran, neue Technologien zu erforschen und dich regelmäßig weiterzubilden
Du hast solide Kenntnisse in einer objektorientierten Programmiersprache und Erfahrung in der Webentwicklung mit einem SPA-Webframework




Was bieten wir dir?




Sehr gute Work-Life-Balance und 30 Tage Urlaub
Hoher Remote-Office-Anteil möglich
Gute Standortanbindung an öffentliche Verkehrsmittel und Autobahn
Klimatisierte Büros und kostenfreier Kaffee, Tee & Wasser vor Ort
Vertrauensarbeitszeit und Gleitzeitkonto
Bezahlte Weiterbildungen und Zertifikate
Zeit für persönliche Weiterentwicklung und Community/Research-Projekte nach Absprache




Unser Jobangebot Fullstack Software Engineer - Cloud / DevOps / Git / Home Office (m/w/d) klingt vielversprechend? Dann freuen wir uns auf eine Bewerbung über Workwise.




Bei unserem Partner Workwise kann man sich in nur wenigen Minuten ohne Anschreiben für diesen Job bewerben und den Status der Bewerbung live verfolgen.

Title: Software Engineer, Telemetry
text:
Our mission is to secure and manage Ubuntu on IoT devices globally. With billions of connected devices running Linux, we think the opportunity for Ubuntu is enormous, and we will need a high-performance, scalable management system to ensure they are healthy, up to date, and doing what they should be doing! Our device management and telemetry team is building a cloud-native solution for large-scale estate and fleet management, ultimately aiming to be the industry standard for devices of every category.




This is an opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and web services at scale.




Canonical's engineering team are at the forefront of the IoT revolution. Ubuntu is the number one Linux for IoT, and with Ubuntu Core we have set the pace for device security. We are now working to expand our portfolio with industry-leading, secure, auditable and reliable telemetry services.




The right candidate will be part of the team that will provide the backbone to our expanding IoT market, enhancing both our on-prem offering as well as scaling to a global cloud-based platform.




What you'll do




Collaborate with a globally distributed team.
Write scalable service APIs in Python and Golang to provide telemetry services.
Develop observability, remote logging, data acquisition, alert and notification, and edge processing capabilities
Work with our infrastructure team to develop both a cloud-based SaaS offering as well as a containerised local on-prem solution.
Design and implement new features and enhancements from spec to production at scale.
Review code and technical designs produced by other engineers.
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions.
Work remotely with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events.




Who you are




You love technology and working with a diverse set of talented people.
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable.
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated.
You have a broad technology base but favor backend code and infrastructure.
You have a good understanding of cybersecurity and the challenges of the IoT environment.
You have knowledge and experience of telemetry systems including data streaming technologies, observability and monitoring systems, and the application of security/IAM models to such systems.
You have proficiency in developing tooling and libraries, and the design and implementation of back-end web services, messaging/data pipelines, and REST APIs using python and/or Golang
You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform.
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree.




About Canonical




Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 1000+ professionals across 70+ countries. We want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace.




What Canonical offers:




Work from home
Learning and development allowances
Competitive Salary
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Generous annual leave
Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave
Priority Pass for travel
Exposure to international business and technology




We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

A world-class multicultural team: we don’t just work together, we truly care about each other and seek to bring out the best in each other every day
If you need more private time to take care of your loved ones then we will try our best to accommodate their needs
A flexible and high-paced work environment, with low hierarchies, competitive compensation, and equity package
We are a remote-first team, so you will have the chance to work from anywhere in Germany, with flexible working hours.




Compensation Range: the compensation range for this role as a base salary is 80,000€ - 110,000€ annually.




Does this sound like you? Then we would love to hear from you! We encourage everyone to apply! In case this role sounds interesting but you don’t think you meet all the qualifications, we will still be happy to hear from you! We are interested to hear about the value you can bring to the role and to HappyOps.




Last but not least, when judging your fit for this position we will not consider your age, gender, sexual identity and/or expression, ethnicity, or religion as these are not relevant to your role within the team.

Title: Data Analyst
text:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.

 

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Ideal Candidate




Fluent in English
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Netherlands.
Analytical mindset. 

Job Requirements

 

Must be living in Netherlands for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.  

Technical requirements to perform the work

 

Access to a laptop or computer which uses:

-       A logon account unique to you

-       Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed

-    Only one member per household may apply

  NB. All products should be provided at your own expense.

 

Benefits

 

· Work up to 20 hours per week.

· Earn a competitive rate of pay.

· Develop your research skills.

· Avoid the long commute.

· Work from the comfort of your home office.

· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!

 

Apply Online Today!

  

This is a freelance, independent contractor position.

Title: Backend Software Engineer
text:
Position Details & Requirements:

We are seeking a talented Backend Software Engineer to join our development team and to help build the Timefold platform, the next step in democratizing planning optimization. Working closely with other backend and frontend developers, as well as optimization engineers, your primary focus will be turning our vision into a reality.




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the backend team to design and build the Timefold platform.
Contribute to cloud deployments and platform optimization.
Create scalable and robust solutions to meet client needs.




Qualifications:

Strong software engineering skills, preferably senior or medior level.
Proficiency in Java, the core backend language.
Experience with Kubernetes, Maven, REST API, and JUnit.
Familiarity with cloud platforms like GCP, AWS, and/or Azure.
Comfortable with containerization tools like Docker.
Knowledge of API design, messaging, and storage solutions.
Desired skills: Quarkus or Spring Boot.
Nice to have skills: 
Familiarity with webhook integration and gRPC 
Exposure to Timefold (or OptaPlanner) and planning optimization. Asciidoc, HTML, JavaScript.
Ability to work remotely or on-site in Czechia/Belgium.




This job is for you if:

You thrive in an all-round backend development role.
You're committed to ongoing growth and skill development.
You're interested in learning from experienced tech entrepreneurs.
You appreciate autonomy while being a team player.
You want to make a real impact!

Our team currently works from Belgium (Ghent office), Czechia, Poland and Canada. But we are happy to add another country to that list. We value regular face-to-face meetings and would require you to travel a couple of times per year.




Apply now! - jobs@timefold.ai




About Timefold:

Timefold is a pioneering commercial open-source software startup focused on planning optimization. With a powerful AI solver, we're addressing real-world planning challenges across various industries. Backed by an early-stage VC, we're on a mission to become a leading AI company in operations-centered industries.

Title: Data Engineer Onboarding & Technical Customer Success (m/w/d)
text:
PlanerAI, wenn Softwarelösung und Nachhaltigkeit zusammenkommen – wir möchten die Lebensmittelverschwendung im Einzelhandel innerhalb der nächsten fünf Jahre mit Hilfe künstlicher Intelligenz halbieren.




Wie wir das machen? Unsere Stärke ist unser einzigartiges Team. Wir sind KI-Expert:innen, Espresso-Liebhaber:innen und Teamplayer:innen! Unser Zusammenhalt schafft nicht nur die beste Lösung für den Endkunden, sondern auch ein nachhaltiges Miteinander, was die PlanerAI zu einem sympathischen Arbeitgeber macht.




Werde auch Du Teil unseres Teams und unterstütze uns als Data Engineer Onboarding & Technical Customer Success (m/w/d)




Wir sind ein dynamisches, stark wachsendes Startup. Bei uns hast Du die Möglichkeit, Deine Aufgaben entsprechend Deinen Fähigkeiten zu gestalten.




Daher möchten wir Dich ermutigen Dich zu bewerben, auch wenn Du einige der bevorzugten Qualifikationen nicht ganz erfüllst.




Aufgaben




Als Teil unseres Onboarding-Teams ist es Deine Aufgabe die PlanerAI bei




unseren Kunden schnellstmöglich einsatzbereit zu machen. Du analysierst Kundendaten, passt unsere Daten-Konnektoren auf die spezifischen Rohdaten an und erstellst ansprechende Datenauswertungen. Wir bieten Dir die Möglichkeit, Deine data-science skills für ein sinnvolles Produkt einzubringen und in einem kompetenten Team täglich weiterzuentwickeln.




Du analysierst Kundendaten und bringst sie mit Hilfe unserer Konnektoren in unser Datenmodell
Du hast Spaß an der Arbeit mit Rohdaten und erarbeitest Dir ein Verständnis für die Zusammenhänge zwischen den Prozessen beim Kunden und den dabei anfallenden Daten
Du bist maßgeblich dafür verantwortlich, unsere Pipeline beim Kunden am Laufen zu halten
Du hilfst uns dabei unseren Onboarding Work-Flow laufend weiter zu verbessern




Qualifikation




Du bringst eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung, Studium oder ähnliche Qualifikation mit
Du hast Freude an der Arbeit mit großen Datensätzen
Du hast schon erste Erfahrungen mit Python zur Datenverarbeitung, -auswertung und -visualisierung (z.B. pandas, ggplot/plotnine) machen können
Gerne bringst du auch schon Erfahrung mit Kedro, PostgreSQL, oder Git mit
Du sprichst verhandlungssicheres Deutsch
Du arbeitest gerne im Team und organisationsübergreifend
Du bist eine ehrliche und zuverlässige Person, die eine offene Kommunikation zu schätzen weiß




Benefits




25 Urlaubstage und 5 Tage Bildungsurlaub im Jahr, die Dir zur freien Verfügung stehen, denn wir möchten Dir die Möglichkeit deiner persönlichen Weiterbildung geben!
Wir kommen Deiner individuellen Lebensplanung entgegen: Du hast bei uns die Möglichkeit deine Arbeitszeit frei zu gestallten. Du kannst full-remote bzw. hybrid arbeiten oder jeden Tag den wahrscheinlich besten Espresso nördlich der Alpen in unserem Büro genießen- zu Deinem 1. Arbeitstag und zu unserem monatlichen Teamevent freuen wir uns Dich bei uns im Büro zu treffen
Ein strukturiertes, auf Dich und deine Bedürfnisse zugeschnittenes Onboarding ist für uns eine Selbstverständlichkeit - Dein Buddy freut sich schon Dich zu unterstützen und Dir den Start bei uns, angenehm zu gestalten
Wir arbeiten mit Vertrauensarbeitszeiten und freier Arbeitszeitgestaltung, in den Möglichkeiten Deiner Rolle
Wir statten Dich in deinem Homeoffice mit modernem Equipment aus - Du entscheidest, ob Du lieber mit Mac oder Lenovo arbeiten möchtest
Wir möchten dich unterstützen, Dich nach deinen Wünschen und Vorstellungen abzusichern und bieten Dir daher die Möglichkeit einer betrieblichen Altersvorsorge
Wir möchten Dich zu regelmäßigen Teamevents und Teambuildings einladen – Ob paddeln über den Bodensee, 3D-Minigolf spielen oder ein BBQ am Main genießen wir freuen uns auf Dich!




Gemeinsam mit Dir wollen wir die führende Planungslösung für frische Lebensmittel in Europa werden.




Worauf wartest Du noch? Bewirb Dich jetzt!




Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung

Title: Software Engineer - Graphics - Direct Hire [Remote]
text:
ABOUT US:

Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.

JOB TYPE: Direct Hire/ FTE Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)
LOCATION: Remote - Europe
SALARY RANGE: $25,000 – $40,000/yr
ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term
BRAINTRUST JOB ID: 6978


THE OPPORTUNITY

About Us

Collaborative 3D building design tool (Think Figma for building designs).

More than 4k users globally with renowned firms like WeWork, Square Yards, etc implementing projects on Snaptrude. Backed by Accel Partners, Foundamental, Tiferes VC among other notable investors.

Qualifications

1+ years of graphics development work experience, preferably with exposure to WebGL, threejs, GLSL shaders etc
Very strong fundamentals in Javascript programming & computer graphics
An added benefit if familiar with ExpressJS and/or Django frameworks
Strong fundamentals in Algorithms & Data Structures
You learn quickly, regardless of the languages and technologies used
You have experience taking ownership and shipping entire features end-to-end
A strong focus on user experience. You're someone who's passionate about building beautiful, modern UX that people love.
What you’ll be working on

Build modular, reusable components and features for our graphics engine
Own & implement modules in the product with a huge amount of autonomy
Find and address graphics & rendering issues
Collaborate with a small and nimble team of engineers


Apply Now!

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Title: Junior System Engineer - Microsoft Windows (m/w/d)
text:
dynexo, ein Unternehmen der DISION Technologies Group, ist spezialisiert auf IT- und Cyber-Security-Lösungen.




Mit einem erfahrenen Team aus Experten bieten wir unseren Kunden individuelle Beratung und maßgeschneiderte Lösungen, um ihre IT-Infrastruktur sicher und geschützt zu halten.




Von der Netzwerksicherheit bis hin zur Cloud-Sicherheit bieten wir ein breites Spektrum an Dienstleistungen, Rund um Security, Informationssicherheit und Datenschutz.




Gemeinsam mit unseren Entwicklungsteams stellen wir sicher, dass Anwendungen, Dienste und Systeme sicher sind und den neuesten Industriestandards entsprechen.




Aufgaben




Wir suchen einen motivierten Junior System Engineer, der sich auf Microsoft Betriebssysteme und Digitalisierung spezialisiert hat und unser Team bei dynexo unterstützen möchte!




Als DevOps Engineer bei dynexo wirst du verantwortlich sein für die Implementierung und Wartung von Lösungen in On-Premises und Cloud-Infrastrukturen.




Du wirst auch eng mit unseren Entwicklern zusammenarbeiten, Playbooks und Routinen entwicklen, um sicherzustellen, dass unsere Anwendungen sicher sind und den neuesten Industriestandards entsprechen.




Um erfolgreich in dieser Rolle zu sein, solltest du ein Verständnis für Microsoft-Architekturen und Digitalisierung haben, sowie Erfahrung in der Implementierung von Lösungen in Cloud-Umgebungen.




Du solltest auch Erfahrung in der Verwendung von Automatisierungswerkzeugen haben, um sicherzustellen, dass unsere Systeme und Anwendungen verfügbar und ständig geschützt sind.




Zu deinen Aufgaben gehören:




Aufbau und Konfiguration von IT-Systemen, On-Premises und in der Cloud
Entwicklung und Weiterentwicklung von IT-Systemen
Mitwirken an Projekten mit IT-Schwerpunkt
Unterstützung bei der Umsetzung von IT-Lösungen
Fehleranalyse und Troubleshooting




Qualifikation




Studium in der Informatik, Ausbildung oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Kenntnisse und Erfahrung im Umgang mit IT-Systemen
Kenntnisse zu Microsoft Betriebssystemen und Linux
sichere Deutschkenntnisse, in Wort und Schrift (C1-Level)
Englischkenntnisse, in Wort und Schrift




Benefits




Ein junges, dynamisches, internationales Team, das offen für neue Ideen und Innovationen ist
Eine entspannte Arbeitsumgebung mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Ein familien- und kinderfreundliches Arbeitsumfeld
Ein attraktives Gehaltspaket mit Bonusmöglichkeiten
Ein umfangreiches Benefits-Paket inkl. Dienstrad und betrieblicher Altersvorsorge
Kontinuierliche Schulungen und Fortbildungen
Regelmäßige Firmen-Veranstaltungen und Team-Events




Worauf wartest du noch?




Du hast Leidenschaft für Informatik, Mathematik, Programmierung oder Online-Zocken und hast Lust in einem aufregenden Umfeld zu arbeiten, dann bewirb dich bei uns!




Wir freuen uns darauf, dich kennenzulernen.

Title: Software Engineer - Python and K8s
text:
Our mission is to reinvent the way companies manage their open source information systems - on public clouds and in their own data centres. To achieve that we are building a new community around Python opscode for open source applications, running on Kubernetes. We want to move all of Canonical and Ubuntu IS onto this new, open source codebase.




We are confident that we can dramatically improve the experience of running complex business operations - and then we can help our customers embrace those new techniques and products. Traditionally, IS is an inward-facing operation. We would like to transform our IS team into an extension of the product engineering capability at Canonical. Our internal workloads are in many cases the same open source workloads that our customers want to operate. This team will productise those workloads for real-time automated operations on Kubernetes.




This role is ideal for software engineers who enjoy Python, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a role that requires rigour in both code and customer interactions. Our engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.




Strong Python development skills and familiarity with Kubernetes are key requirements of this role. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure your products operate reliably, efficiently and scale to production sized workloads for our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology. You will participate and be responsible for ensuring sound software architecture and follow best practices in software quality, testing and documentation.




What you'll do




Work in Python to design and deliver open source software operations code
Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
Learn to think rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability
Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure
Simplify open source operations for our customers and open source community
Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code
Follow agile software development practices
Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights
Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with company values
Work from home with global travel once or twice a year for up to 2 weeks for events




Who you are




You love technology and working with brilliant people
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations
You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud
You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes
You are an experienced Python programmer and enjoy challenging projects
You understand the importance of reliable software and strive to design and code to that expectation
You are organized and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software




About Canonical




Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.




We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.




#Stack
